Reviews.Title: FUN PHONE..GREAT VALUE!
Reviews.Author: Ted Hoagland
Reviews.Content: after being hesitant about a windows phone, I went ahead and purchased this phone..I figured the specs were decent, and the price was a good selling point. All I can say is KICK ASS PHONE! still learning the interface, it is slick and smooth..the OS windows 8 is very nice!..I know windows phones are way behind to the other two kids on the block, BUT sales are definitely getting better every quarter..People get a windows phone, you will not be disappointed. And just remember MICROSOFT is sitting on a mountain of cash to keep the phone business operating. GET ONE!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: J. parry "jimp"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a person that uses hundreds of apps and this is why the strait forward design of this Windows phone was attractive. I had already purchased the Surface and  this phone is a good match in operation. It seems to have most of the apps I need available, and they work well. I like the functionality of putting all the things commonly used on the start screen and a simple slide shows everything available on the device. I've had it for a couple of weeks and don't feel the need to go back to an Android. The only drawback from buying it on Amazon is that T-Mobile stores sell it $50 cheaper and I had to take it to the T-Mobile store anyway because my old sim card did not fit. They were able to cut it down at the store and set the phone up for me. Very helpful. For that reason alone I would say you'd do well to buy it at the store.

Reviews.Title: A Nice Upgrade From Standard Phone
Reviews.Author: McCard
Reviews.Content: Saved only about $5 off Walmart in store pricing. T-Mobile wants $144 for this phone? I don't need an expensive phone and the fact that 25% of all phones are lost or stolen every year makes this purchase a wiser choice. Bought two of them for myself and daughter and signed up for the T-Mobile Simple Choice Plans. You have to install the micro sim card unless you already have one. We had standard sim cards previously that are too big. Was worried about the Windows OS but everything is working great so far. Phone, Camera, MP3 Player and can add plenty of free apps plus up to a 64MB Micro SD Card. Battery life so far average. Average to less than average user. Heavy use and plan on charging more often.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was kind of skeptical at first about purchasing this phone, given the low price.  It turns out that it is a fantastic little phone.  There are some features I wished it had, like a front camera, and anti glare when out in the sun.  You also need to remove your finger prints often.  But then again, this phone is under $130 and will do pretty much anything you need it to do, so I have no real complaint against it.  I also bought (off of amazon of course), a silicone case, which may be the reason, after several times dropped, the phone shows no sign of wear.  I would also advise purchasing a screen guard.  If you need to consider economy, than this is a great phone, and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Bulletproof.
Reviews.Author: StudioDude
Reviews.Content: These things are bulletproof. You could bring one of these to hell and back, and the phone would still work.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Value, Great Reception, Restarts Too Often, Challenges Out of the Box/Setup
Reviews.Author: C. Clay "drakkar91"
Reviews.Content: Once T-Mobile introduced the all inclusive (talk, text, web) for $50 a month with no contract, I knew it was time to buy a new phone and replace my "known memory issues" phone, the Samsung Gravity Smart Android Phone, Sapphire Blue (T-Mobile).  My first cell phone ever (in 2004) was a Nokia no frills model.  That would be followed by 3 Samsung models (2 flip phones that were very good and a smart phone that was utter junk).  Based on how poor the Samsung product was I was using, I looked away from Samsung and decided to give Nokia a chance again - and this time with Windows 8.  I must admit, I had little clue what the major differences would entail.Opening the Box and Basic Start-up:Out of the box and initial setup was a 1-star event.  The back cover is as tight (or tighter) than a spaceship cover.  I had to actually take it to a T-Mobile store and have them remove the back (which they did easily).  Next up, the battery.  Inserting it was no issue, but getting it out?  To this day, that requires a paper clip!  Even a veteran Smartphone user at work couldn't get it out.  Why did I need to get it out you ask?  After charging it, I needed to insert my SIM card from my old phone.The SIM Card:The SIM card slot is underneath the battery and smaller than the one I was using from a phone about 3 years old.  TIP: The T-Mobile rep had a device that could cut the old SIM card to fit the new phone (while also allowing you to switch it back to your old phone if the new one failed).  This is important if your cell phone is your only means of communication (nice to have a backup option).  Otherwise, you would need to activate the new SIM card which comes with the phone and that renders the old SIM card worthless.Contacts Import:Another fail. The "oh so easy" process to import did not work.  A 45 minute call with T-Mobile and a 30 minute chat with Windows Support and eventually we got lucky.  Unfortunately, it created 2 Outlook profiles and now one had to be deleted.  Because it's a Windows phone, my guess is it wanted me to create an Outlook account, vs. using my GMAIL account.  I did that, then we had to send the contacts CSV file from GMAIL to Outlook.  Then the phone could not import the CSV file and already was advising me to download an App for that!  Enough already!  There was not apparent option to download from My T-Mobile account to the phone.  To which I ask why?  Seems like someone missed a step.Using the Windows Phone Platform - The Early Days:This is no Android phone! If you have never used Windows 8, let alone on a phone, there is a huge learning curve.  Be prepared - if you're not a fighter, you may give up (especially if you're still battling inserting the battery, SIM or importing your contacts).Windows Phone - A Few Weeks Along:It gets better! Once you realize sliding to the left reveals an alphabetical list of applications and options, you'll start to breathe again. It's a Windows Phone, not an iPhone, not an Android.  All 3 platforms have their own quirks, challenges and successes.The Phone and Apps:The keyword is "tiles".  As a Windows phone, it's got a 1 touch button to search Bing!  I use it, I like it.  Of course it has a tile for Internet Explorer, Messaging, your default email (be that Yahoo!, GMAIL or Outlook) and you can add tiles for other email accounts.  Tiles for the Navigation App (Driving) - which is 1,000 times better than whatever was on my Samsung Android.  Many apps are Nokia designed exclusive for the Windows 8 phone, and I like them all (but it takes time to understand and learn some of them, like the music app).  It comes with a phone version of Office (have not used it yet), but no way to open a CSV file (commonly opened with Excel).  Are there less app's for Windows Phone?  Yes, which is also why these phones are still a great value.  Nokia offers several apps titled HERE! and all I have used performed well.Typing or Speaking?Of course it has word prediction technology.  What it doesn't have is memory to remember that you regularly type a word not in its dictionary!  Here the Android beats the Windows phone, as it remembered funny words or names you used often.  It has voice recognition so you can speak your messages - my Android did too, but the Windows Phone is better.  However, within certain apps, the voice option does not appear, which is annoying if you want to speak vs. type your message.Best 2 Pro's:1. I actually have come to like the smooth Windows 8 tile interface. Very receptive to touch!2. Great connectivity - no dropped calls nor failed messages sent (a constant issue with my Samsung Android on the same T-Mobile network). Proof it was the phone, not the network.Worst 2 Con's:1. As other reviewers I have seen mentioned, the phone shuts off / restarts way too often.  Press the button to take a photo, and bam, your phone restarts.  I have read this will be resolved when Windows 8.1 for T-Mobile phones is released, in July 2014 they estimate.2. No flash! Really? My "free" (with contract) Samsung Gravity Smart acquired years ago had a flash!  And flash is available on every other Nokia Lumia phone!  Aaargh - the one cheap design flaw.The Final Verdict:I like my Windows 8 phone, and would recommend it - even buy it again! It truly beats my Samsung Android in almost every aspect.  If the upper tier models were more reasonably priced, I would definitely consider the upgrade for more storage of apps and the camera with flash option.  If you desire iPhone quality photos and video, you won't get it in a $70 to $90 Nokia Lumia, which is justified.  If you are app addicted, you'll need to stick with another platform until Windows Phones become more popular.  If you have had enough of over-priced phones, Android or iPhone living, or you're looking for a fresh, sweet phone with lots of features for an unbeatable price, try the Lumia 521 (but expect a learning curve and some early on challenges).  Give it time!

Reviews.Title: Daughter Loves It, works tolerably well
Reviews.Author: Bob M.
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm cheap. Yes, I use cheap phones for myself, and I attempted to keep my kids using cheap phones for as long as I could. When the day came that my daughter complained that she was the only kid on the block that didn't have a smart phone, well, I just had to do something. This girl sends something like 5,000 text messages a month. Yeah. I checked. I couldn't believe it either, but it was true. Thankfully, unlimited text messaging was cheap. I'm not using a data plan, so it's good to know that you can use this phone like any other cheap phone. Yeah, I know, some day she'll want a data plan. Maybe she'll  have a job by then and can pay for that herself. Or not.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Fantastic budget smartphone! As a new convert to a smartphone from an old fashioned phone this year, I was pretty nervous going in... but the results are GREAT!!!! Easy to learn and does anything you would imagine from a smartphone, all for just 80$!!!!! Very Very Very happy!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kyle A. Messner "China Mom"
Reviews.Content: What a bargain... can't believe it does all it can!  It is my first smart phone ... and yes it isn't gifted like the other phones, but it is plenty smart!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Makol Kelei
Reviews.Content: love it, because it comfortable and easy to used, lighter, wide screen, wifi, and many apps, great music and comara

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: jimmitz
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to try a Windows phone for a while but was afraid I wouldn't like it. I bought this for 79 bucks and was like if I don't like it, meh it's only 80 bucks and not like 400 bucks for some others. I love the Windows phone. This Nokia also does NOT feel like a cheap phone as it's price tag implies.Only two things I don't like about it. 1) it has no front facing camera so its impossible to Skype and 2) it has no flash. Other than that, its a fast phone that is well worth the 80 bucks or whatever it's at right now.

Reviews.Title: Everything we expected
Reviews.Author: Leah Markham
Reviews.Content: This phone was everything we expected and in great condition for a used phone. We were very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: A teens phone
Reviews.Author: sandra
Reviews.Content: My daughter dropped her 520 so I purchased the 521, she wanted a phone that was $200+, get a job.  I haven't heard on any bad things with this phone.

Reviews.Title: A phone I really like it
Reviews.Author: Happy cook
Reviews.Content: solid feeling, easy use, response well.  I only use the phone and text message, this is more than enough for my purposes.Good product!

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 521
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my wife and so far she is 100% satisfied. considering getting one for myself! Would Recommend.

Reviews.Title: What a phone for the price!
Reviews.Author: LHP
Reviews.Content: If you're price conscious and need a smart phone this is a good buy. There is a learning curve for the windows phone but it's not steep and the features that come for this price are unparalleled.

Reviews.Title: love it got it!
Reviews.Author: drew
Reviews.Content: sweet deal got it for 40 bucks!!!!!! on christmas since then it hasnt given me any problems so far great steal for a decent smartphone

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: JIGGY24
Reviews.Content: This is a awesome phone, which cant be beat for the money. Loving the UI and looking forward to upgrading to my next high end Windows phone.

Reviews.Title: Shocking Value
Reviews.Author: Aekero
Reviews.Content: Lots of good about this phone, will keep this review more about the phone itself and not the OS, but as a quick aside the app count is not as big of a deal as I thought it would be. There may be 100s of 1000s more apps for IOS and Android, but Windows Phone has most of the "high usage" apps. Just received my phone a few days ago and coming from Android I'm not missing much. Facebook, Groupon, Pandora, Spotify, Groupme, Instagram to name a few were all readily available.Have to agree with just about everyone on this phone, a friend just picked up an LG Android skinned for around the same price, and this absolutely blows it out of the water.Pros:Display - While not AMOLED quality, very sharp.OS - Coming from Android, or really any smart phone, it's actually very intuitive and easy to set up, I didn't need to read anything to get everything the way I wanted.Windows 8 phone feels extremely well designed, there are things I miss from my Galaxy like the drag down summary screen, but I've found most things easily accessible.Build quality - The phone feels great, it honestly feels better than my last phone which was almost 10 times more expensive.Design - Button placement etc feels good, there are some nice built in hardware touches i.e. hitting the volume rocker pops up your music player, hitting the search button brings up search engine, hitting the camera button (Dedicated camera button on side) brings up the camera app.Speakers - good, already back to using my phone as my portable music player.Speed - This is the low end of the lumia series, but it's virtually unnoticeable. Slight load times occasionally, but for the most part everything opens up smoothly with sharp animations.Internet - Good, you get 4g with this phone, I had 4g lte with my last phone...it's a little slower.Photos - Decent quality, and able to switch through camera programs quickly.Touch screen - This isn't quite on par with the best touch screens, noticeably on the bottom navigation buttons I sometimes have to tap twice, but very responsive.Cons -Headset jack - Sometimes (and it's plugged in firmly), I'll start a music app with the headphones plugged in and it will play over the speakers, if I unplug/replug it after starting the app it will pipe through the headphones, annoying to have to do that though.Dead pixel - Honestly I didn't notice this after 3 days of fiddling around with the phone on..but when I restarted one day and the screen was blank and lit I did notice a dead pixel...absolutely not noticeable during use but still there.Flash - This phone doesn't have one, but be honest how many low light shots really turn out with a camera phone anyways?Forward facing camera - For "Selfies" the easy-to- hit dedicated camera button means selfies are pretty easy to take.. if you facetime or anything like that this won't work.Call quality - During the first day there was noticeable static on the line, through various callers etc, never had that on my old phone.Overall this is retail dollar for dollar probably the best phone out there bar-none. I've researched lots of phones at various price points, demo'd them, gotten feedback from friends, on top of the actual other phones I've owned. Not saying it's better than a GS4, or Iphone5 etc of course but considering how much more they cost. (at certain times this phone drops to $60-70 with no contract) this is a ridiculously good deal, a no-brainer 5 star product.Honestly this phone is still a backup when it's all said and done, I'll use it as my primary phone for the next 6 months, but I'll upgrade when my plan allows. That being said, I'm not really biased towards any of the major 3 players, and this phone has planted Windows Phone as a contender for my $$ when I purchase a top of the line phone. If nothing else this phone is so cheap it's a great way to explore Windows Phone without breaking the bank, or an amazing kids first phone.

Reviews.Title: GREAT for price
Reviews.Author: devhead
Reviews.Content: Great entry to W8P. I have had a Lumia 900 with W7P for about a year now, and it frustrates me.This Lumia 521, for the price, blows the 900 away.Vs. the 900 Cons:  lower res. camera, no flash  no forward camera.  usb/charge port on bottom. If you want to stand it up (portrait) while cord attached, this is a problem. The 900 is on top.Vs. the 900 Pros:  PRICE: 60% lower  Battery: better life and REMOVEABLE  Storage: my 900 has 16GB but not expandable. My 521 has 8GB but expandable with up to 32GB microSD.  Slightly smaller, slimmer, lighter.  OS: W8P surpasses W7P. Not by miles, of course. This IS Microsoft ;-)Bottom line: Nokia still makes great hardware. If you want an inexpensive entry to Nokia smartphones and W8P, buy this phone.PS: I bought mine from a different online retailer for similar price. It came in a sealed box with a SIM card and activation instructions.I used my existing T-Mobile SIM card and it worked right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: What an upgrade from Android!
Reviews.Author: Crisro
Reviews.Content: I guess it's really about what you want.  I have used Windows for years, so learning this phone was a piece of cake.  I won't buy from Apple because of their elitist attitudes, ridiculous prices and Chinese slave labor.  Plus, I have an IPad for my work and it is a piece of crap.  And Android... don't even get me started.  Between ridiculous apps that no one needs and a system that continually glitches and drains batteries, I have never had a good Android phone -- from high end Samsungs to HTC's they all suck.  This Windows phone is solid, weighs as much as a good IPhone (not the plastic pieces of junk they are peddling now), its batteries last at least two days with continual phone and Internet usage and it is totally glitch free -- have only had to reboot once in two months.  Combined with the ridiculously low T-Mobile no-contract rates, there is absolutely no comparison and anyone who believes those who shill for the high-priced Galaxys deserves to lose the money they are wasting.  The OS here is as stable and reliable as Windows 7 on a computer and, for a phone, that's saying something.  Also, at the 129 price I paid for this, it was a steal.  At the current 80 bucks, you would be a fool not to try it and give it a chance.  It will cut your bills and your frustration levels in half. Oh, I almost forgot -- it's a great phone, wonderful speaker, high volume ringer and telephonic quality that in a good signal area (3 bars or more) rivals a hard line. In 20 years of cell phone usage, I have never had one that sounded this good.

Reviews.Title: mind BLOWN!
Reviews.Author: sisally
Reviews.Content: This phone is absolutely amazing. I was iffy about purchasing cuz its such a cheap deal. But once it arrived at my door, my jaw dropped at the quality! The phone I recently had was a piece of junk, the Kyocera rise by virgin mobile. The keyboard fell apart and I caught viruses from downloading music from a bad app. So my phone was all together slow and worthless. Once I got my new windows 8 in my hands I broke the Kyocera. I plan to never go back to that piece of junk. Basically, this phone is just like the new windows 1020. Any windows phone has great quality and high definition! Pictures are great, even without a flash! Its easy to take pics in a dim lighted room. The music sounds great! Mega bass with my headphones. And guess what? You ca watch tv and on demand !! Movies are great and Microsoft store has apps just for movies! Definitely recommend this to anyone. I'm completely satisfied. I'm done jabbering now, gonna watch some tv on my awesome new phone!

Reviews.Title: A sold offering from an underdog supplier at a price you can't beat
Reviews.Author: W. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: This is a good basic smart phone. Wifi connectivity works well. Screen sensitivity is good and the tile layout is intuitive and easy to learn, even for a mac guy like me. I was a little concerned with battery life, but it goes days between charges, which is partially a reflection on how little I use the phone each day. If you have an apple computer, you need to download software to your mac to connect to the phone. My only complaint is that I've not found a way to delete any of the default apps. I don't use many of them and they waste space on the phone.

Reviews.Title: Replacement
Reviews.Author: Mrsmusgrove
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone because my previous phone became my sons play toy. As far as quality it feels delicate, not much weight to it how i like it. Battery life not that great but manageable, maybe i have apps running and dont know it. I would recommend a case cover, ive had it for a few hours and dropped it twice because it just slipped out my hand (thankfully it feel both times on my lap). Camera not too great and im use to a front facing camera. And for whatever reason when the phone is charging the back of the phone gets really hot. Not as many free apps as an andriod but again, this was just a temporary phone. If you are new to a smartphone this would be perfect, want to give ur kids an updated but but not spend $300+ this is good. I paid $108 including tax and received it in 2 days. Nice phone just scare to hold it when standing on concrete lol. Trust me, get a case with grip or a so that if u drop it, it wont break.

Reviews.Title: Nokia nothing realy to say
Reviews.Author: VITA
Reviews.Content: I have to say Nokia is coming back combination of value what you get for this price is excellent I did not have so far any issues with this phone and I thing they did great job. If you are not crazy Apple person definitely I can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumina 521...Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Odette
Reviews.Content: The Nokia Lumina is a fantastic buy, it's less expensive than an Apple IPhone, but, stll has Windows 8, is easier to use, and you are not trapped into ITunes.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price.
Reviews.Author: Kevin A. Dixon "Mark"
Reviews.Content: I bought this from HSN for $79 to replace my aging unlocked iPhone 3, "I refuse to sign another phone contract for two years, using T-Mobile $30 unlimited Text and Data plan that you can only get from Walmart" and I am not disappointing. Not the most advanced phone out but it does the Job. Only thing I miss is a few apps flipboard and pocket, I'm happy until the Nexus 5 is released.Update1 month in and still happy. More apps are coming and the performance have been great. I love the SD card expansion for video and music, only wish I could save apps to the SD card.Now how to unlock this thing to take out of the country

Reviews.Title: Great Phone really like it
Reviews.Author: Pat Johnson
Reviews.Content: great phone love the apps very freindly use.  Would recommend this for anyone.  I brought for my daughters birthday.She loves it and carries it everywhere

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Jared Cox
Reviews.Content: Great phone.  Switching from an android to the windows mobile platform has been painless.  Everything has been working as I would expect it to without having to look for instructions.  A couple of my apps aren't directly available (Google voice for example), but the voice webpage still works and there are substitute apps that work as well.  Check the windows mobile store before you switch to check for app availability.

Reviews.Title: 2 small things wrong..
Reviews.Author: Eric Jones
Reviews.Content: The headset port is faulty. My wife got the same phone and it did the same thing.. When you plug in earplugs, the sound quality is horrible..Also, no front facing camera for chatting..

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone
Reviews.Author: Sharif Rizal
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone, easy to use and comes with pretty much all the features you need for a basic / entry level smart phone.If you are wondering if this phone comes with a MicroSIM, the answer is YES and it works with regular post-paid plans. All you will need to do is log in to your my-tmobile portal and activate the included SIM card (which usually takes less than a minute).I'm very happy with this phone and really like the wireless hotspot / tethering option which lets you setup the phone a hotspot device to share mobile internet connection. Battery life is about 3 days fully stand-by which I think is pretty decent for a smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Daphne Lancaster
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Great phone.  Does all of the functions to keep life organized and tidy.  Great price as well.

Reviews.Title: Best No Contract Phone Available
Reviews.Author: Dane Solon
Reviews.Content: I have the 520, which is essentially the 521.By far, the best low cost, no contract phone I've used.  Win8 is much faster than I expected with no lag.Also runs all of the new Windows apps, unlike the no contract Androids that are running 2 year old "Honeycomb" that cannot run new Android software.Overall, great hardware for the price.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: oliver
Reviews.Content: It is everything I expected and more. it is as advertised. Yes I would recommend this product to a friend.

Reviews.Title: It's a steal guys at this price point.
Reviews.Author: K. Kanaujia
Reviews.Content: This is a steal at $118 and similar feature worse looking Samsung selling at more then $300 at least.. It was a no brainier for me and I loved the value i got from this buy... Windows apps are smooth and I have all the apps I need.. People should not have complains that there are not enough apps on windows...The build quality is awesome and looks better then any other prepaid smartphone at the moment...

Reviews.Title: Ehh
Reviews.Author: trumpetgirl5
Reviews.Content: My mom got this phone for my brother and all he does is complain about how much he hates it. Its slow! Also if you like to have a background, don't get this phone. You can't have backgrounds.

Reviews.Title: respone to the purchase review
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie S.
Reviews.Content: I thought that it was a great phone for the price, however I did not keep the phone because when I checked out the features of the phone I found out that it did not support the play store aps that I use on a daily basis.  I need the aps to support my ministry and the nokia lumia 521 did not give me the things that I need in an android phone ,other wise it was a great phone.

Reviews.Title: wrong screen protector
Reviews.Author: George W. Cornish
Reviews.Content: Nice case...fit correctly on my nokia lumina 521however the screen protector was for model nokia 520and did not fit my 521

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive, fast, very fast, takes great pictures and battery last longer than my IPhone's 5
Reviews.Author: cmarti
Reviews.Content: I got this for my daughter, she is in love with her phone. The T-Mobile internet connection is fast, the cell takes great pictures and the Facebook app for winmo is robust.Pair this phone with the Eagle Cell PRNK521SPSTHLPLBK cover to protect your investment.I like this phone so much that I am considering buying one for my wife. (iPhone 4s user)

Reviews.Title: I would really love to have this phone
Reviews.Author: Willie Neo
Reviews.Content: I would really love to have this phone. My friend got one I usually borrow it and I really like the features of the phone. It would be very cool to have this phone.

Reviews.Title: Good Value, decent all around capabilities, night time function not so good/camera has no flash and keys don't light up
Reviews.Author: S. Yee
Reviews.Content: It's a decent phone especially for the price.  The apps seems limited compared to apps you can get for iphone/droid.  The camera no good for taking photos where there is no light/when it's dark out.  The camera is quirky as well when taking pictures, this circle icon appears and it takes like 3s for it to focus and take a shot.  It would be even better if the camera button had two stages, half press to focus, and full press to take shot, which it does not.  It only offers a full press that focuses and takes the shot which you have to wait 3s and hope that the shot is good at the end of the 3s.  Also the keys don't light up in the dark so you have to guess where the keys are.  It would be way more of a complete package with a flash and lit keys.  So 4 stars if you appreciate value which I do, but it's really more of a 3 star phone in terms of functionality compared to other phones.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: Good phone at a good prices. Well satisfied. Easy to use. Good. Battery life.  This  review  takes too long to fill out.

Reviews.Title: Nokia
Reviews.Author: tynecca
Reviews.Content: I love my new Nokia windows phone the only thing is I wish it had a flash and a front camera but the phone still take good pictures

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: WUILLIANS ESCALONA
Reviews.Content: LIKE ME PHONE, BRAND IS GOOD, LOVE THE CAMERA AND FUNCTIONS IS VERY QUICK WITH COVERAGE IN GOOD GOOD CAMERA RESOLUTION IMAGES

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Sivarama K.
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised that windows phone can be so good. Excellent value.  is n't a sleek one. would recommend it to any one looking at a windows phone at good value.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone - Buy at Walmart!
Reviews.Author: Thomas C.
Reviews.Content: The phone handled pretty nice when I played with it at the store (Walmart).I would buy it at Walmart though.  Amazon sent me a USED phone that T mobile put a lock on since the previous owner did not pay for it entirely. I of course sent it back to Amazon.  Save yourself the time & trouble! Buying at Walmart, you know you are getting a NEW phone!  Plus Walmart has their $30 / month prepaid cards/sims that give you 5 GB(unlimited 2g after using up 5GB at 4g), unlimited Texts, & 100 minutes voice/ month.  Walmart sells Tmobile phones and even their "Family plan" prepaid phones are compatible with Tmobile since they use Tmobile's network.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, and deserves >5 stars
Reviews.Author: BVD
Reviews.Content: The phone does everything I want a smartphone to do for me.  1. Very clear when making phone calls; 2. Very smooth automatic connection to WIFI when it is available; 3.  Has all the apps I need (<10; not sure why people need millions of apps).  NOKIA MUSIC is fantastic.  Ads free music with offline availability.  We have not listened to Pandora since getting this phone.  HERE DRIVE is available offline as a GPS with turn to turn voice guided direction.  BING, although not as good as Chrome at doing searches, provides excellent results for locations of interest (restaurant, stores, etc) with link to tripadvisor's detailed location info that can be pinned to screen (address, phone, direction) and automatic link to phone call or HERE DRIVE with a simple click.  SKYPE is available for chat, and calls to landlines for a very small fee. LIVE TILES allow me to view schedules on my calendar, pictures, music, new mails/messages, etc.  Even Nook for reading books and NETFLIX for watching movies if I wanted to do this, but honestly who would do this on a small phone?  Youtube HD is good even though Google decided not to make it available for windows phone for competitive reason, but again who would watch youtube on a phone with better devices (smart TV, computers, tablets, etc) readily available anywhere in the house or workplaces.  Most of all, I got the phone for $70 with $20 credits for the APP store.  I could easily replace it if I break it, lose it or whatever bad happens to it.  Very easy to navigate.  My 8 year old told me that it was more clearly laid out than his mini.  He even downloaded some games on my phone and plays with my phone instead of the mini from time to time.  One so called weakness is the lack of front facing camera.  It is not an issue for me because I stopped doing video calling a couple years ago after the novelty went away for me.  All in all, it is a very good quality phone for those who are on a budget or NOT.

Reviews.Title: Pretty useful for the cost.  Great for kids.
Reviews.Author: SeattleMariners
Reviews.Content: Pros:* Reliable and easy to use.* Great for users who are used to Windows, especially Windows 8.* Comes with SkyDrive and can automatically upload all pictures, and OneNote messages, which you can fully organize on your laptop with the access of the SkyDrive.* Battery charges quickly.Cons* Does not have a front-facing camera (You can't Video-chat)* Camera quality could be a bit betterWith this price, you can't complain much.  I'm always online with PCs, and relatively a light-user for smart phones, so this is more than enough for me.  Will buy another for my kids.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use
Reviews.Author: justMe
Reviews.Content: I love this phone! I will admit I am the least tech-savvy person I know aside from my mother, so it doesn't take a lot to impress me. But this phone impresses me. The battery life is good. The signal strength varies but I live in the middle of BFE...I have had to look up how to do things...like get my voicemail, but other than that, pretty straightforward.

Reviews.Title: I'd buy it again
Reviews.Author: Carla Hidalgo
Reviews.Content: Overall good and easy phone to work with.  Has everything i need and the camera is actually pretty good even when its kind of dark.The only issue i have is while on a phone call, the mute and hold buttons constantly get pushed by my hair or ear or somehting and its super annoying.  Even if you lock the screen while on a call it unlocks after a bit and happens all over again.Otherwise, no complaints.  Totally worth the money.

Reviews.Title: It's alright
Reviews.Author: Erwin Riau
Reviews.Content: The mail app doesn't work. But other then that it's a great entry level smart phones. For people looking to buy this phone should also look into galaxy from samsung

Reviews.Title: Great phone....
Reviews.Author: cicely
Reviews.Content: I like how the phone takes good pictures and a great!! Windows phone!!!!! Love this phone very much I will be ordering one for my son lol....

Reviews.Title: NIce for its price
Reviews.Author: Mostafa Ghobadi
Reviews.Content: I like it for its low price and reasonable quality , if it had a front camera and a compass, it would be a great smartphone in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Anna Gettinger
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for several months and am very pleased with it. It is my first windows phone. The major complaint about it is that it does not have a front camera, but if you do not plan to skype through your phone a lot it is not a problem. Without the battery safer mode turned on this phone dies very quickly. I simply leave it in battery saver mode and charge it every night and have never had it die on me. In fact it will last a couple days without charge if the battery saver mode is on. Overall I would say this is a great phone especially for someone getting a windows phone for the first time.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Depree
Reviews.Content: I'm an American expat in the Dominican Republic.  I have several Dominican friends that  often ask me to order things for them from Amazon because selection and price are better than here, even with shipping.A computer tech friend asked me to order this.  He has been using it for a few weeks and is very pleased.  He says it is fast on the internet, the camera works fine, when he Skypes with the phone there are no problems either with the phone or the camera, the battery lasts as long as expected, the ringer is loud enough for him, the incoming voice is loud and clear and from  all reports his voice is well received by  those he is talking with.He highly recommends the  camera, so I won't be surprised if others also ask me to order for them.

Reviews.Title: Great budget phone.
Reviews.Author: Richard D.H. Cook
Reviews.Content: Bought for my daughter as an emergency phone and media player. Added some extra memory.Great phone she loves it.Only down side is there isn't a flash or front facing camera. I knew this before buying but it would have been a nice to have.FYI: Got the $100 pay in advance SIMM from TMobile which should last a year. The "Pay In Advance" option is really hard to find on their web site.

Reviews.Title: Great Cheap Phone
Reviews.Author: Ismary Linares "Iluvbooks"
Reviews.Content: Bought for parents as their first smart phone. Very simple but great phone. All the icons are on the home screen and I made them large enough so my parents don't get confused. They are excited to have access to new technology without being overwhelmed by it. I highly recommend this phone especially for people that are new to smart phones.

Reviews.Title: Good starter smart phone
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: This is my first smart phone and so far I am happy with it. While it may not have all the apps offered by Apple and Android, it's still great to finally have internet and GPS wherever I go. Great value!

Reviews.Title: GOOD
Reviews.Author: Chun-Ping Chueh
Reviews.Content: Though it do take times for the webpage to response , it is quite cheaper than other cell phone. It's light.

Reviews.Title: Not Recommended if Coming from an iPhone 4 or higher (Stick with Your iPhone)
Reviews.Author: Amazon
Reviews.Content: Cons:*Confusing. For instance you have to pay for apps different than the Nokia music that's different than Xbox music. With iPhones the same payment method is captured between the iPhone app store and iTunes. I like that they both syncs up that way. Everything is interrelated with the iPhone.*Whether I'm using the Tmo network or wifi, pages load more slowly than with iPhone.*Also, there are not as many apps or podcasts for Windows, but there are enough to keep me occupied and who needs all those games? This is great for helping me be productive. I must say, however, because there are less podcasts, I was able to find Joan Sotkin, which I never would have found or be introduced through iTuns on iPhone. (I love her. She approaches prosperity from a holistic viewpoint.)Pros*I love the customizable live tiles. You can see what the weather is like without opening up the app. I've made direct links to Coast to Coast Am, Contacttalkradio.com, and my favorite music, all without having to open the app to play them. (I miss Hay House Radio though, but I can listen to that on my computer.)*You can try out apps for developers who let you, so you don't invest/commit money and then not be happy with your purchase.*Phone quality seems nicer. I'm not saying "huh" every other sentence on some calls.*UPGRADABLE memory. For around less than $50 I am at 64gigs plus the original 8 that came with the phone. Should I upgrade my phone, I can just bring the card with me. SCORE!Hopefully I can get over the little bit slower lag time it takes for the screens to load on the Internet. Otherwise, I am happy with my purchase. You can find this phone from $20-120. Shop around. Last time I saw, Frys Electronics was offering a $20 phone with Metro service through some kind of rebate. No bad. The vendor through Amazon changes prices regularly charging from $75 to $99. Again, shop around. HSN had this phone for $75, plus you get a phone cover and other extras.I would prefer the iPhone 5s, but for reasons I won't get into here, I am beholdin to the Windows phone.Also, I found out that Nokia is offering an instant $20 app card with the purchase of this phone. It works; I received $20 with the verification of activation. Hopefully you can too.Merry Christmas!!

Reviews.Title: Stellar!
Reviews.Author: Merkin
Reviews.Content: Can't really say much that will add to the great reviews for this device.I was so impressed with Nokia and WP8 I ended up purchasing another Lumia 521.I have moved on to the Lumia 925.The 521 showed me what the Windows Phone is all about.I rate this and the Lumia 520 the best smartphone deals going to date.This thing even supports the latest 128 gig microSD cards!All I can say is "unbeatable" for anyone looking to go with Microsoft and Nokia as a willing first timer.

Reviews.Title: For this price and quality, anyone complaining is crazy!
Reviews.Author: Michael Madsen "The Relic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone not knowing what to expect, having never used a Windows phone before. The price was incredible and almost seemed to good to be true. (I paid more for the phone than it is selling for now keep in mind) I was skeptical.Once I started using it I was amazed. It is a fantastic phone for the price paid, well worth it. The only thing I would say to people coming from iPhone or Android, like I did, is that not a lot of people are developing apps for Windows phone, so there isn't a lot of choice sometimes on apps. Usually you can find what you're looking for. Pretty minor issue for a good phone. Overall I've been really happy with the phone.

Reviews.Title: Smart phone
Reviews.Author: nikki horner
Reviews.Content: Really inventive features and functionality. Glad I purchased this item. Good pre paid phone for the price and quality above all.

Reviews.Title: A great deal!
Reviews.Author: janet johnson
Reviews.Content: This phone is exactly what I ordered for my daughter and she loves it! It came earlier than projected too.

Reviews.Title: very good phone
Reviews.Author: kw
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my dad but I had to give it to my son bz it was hard for my dad to use, but it is a very nice phone.  My son love it.

Reviews.Title: Best smartphone for its price!!
Reviews.Author: Mack Gao
Reviews.Content: Simple yet sleek, light yet powerful. Best purchase for a smartphone with so many functions. This is the best windows phone on the market right now!!

Reviews.Title: Geezer approved
Reviews.Author: jBj
Reviews.Content: Windows is what you're buying here more than a phone.Going on three months with the Lumia 521.No regrets here for the 99 dollars paid.This isn't a glistening shiny hefty phablet that is seen being clutched by so many these days.It's just an easy to use 4 inch screen smartphone with all those features wanted by us late comers.I'm older and retired and found this device very friendly and enjoyable to use.I like this phone so well I bought another one.Good job Nokia/Microsoft!

Reviews.Title: pretty cool phone
Reviews.Author: NEO "Stupidity Kills"
Reviews.Content: can't go wrong with a nokia phone. with windows 8, so yeah! multi-tasking.  touch screen, i think $125 is satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: Great Affordable Smartphone
Reviews.Author: Quy H. Phung
Reviews.Content: I've had the phone for over a week now.  It's been great so far for the price I paid ($117).  I'm using it under T-Mobiles pay as you go plan.  I'm usually within range of a wifi signal, so I did not want to pay for a monthly plan.  I added a 32 MB micro SD card and I'm able to put all my pictures and music on my phone.  Off line GPS is great.  Learning to use a Windows Phone was easy.  The operating systems is very intuitive.  Also, I'm able to find the apps that I need.  The camera took fairly good pictures.  Can't believe how well this phone compares to my wife's expensive iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Fabrizio68
Reviews.Content: Great phone and great apps. I am very happy with my purchase. I would love to buy the newest nokia lumia soon

Reviews.Title: Good phone, good price
Reviews.Author: chen longbin
Reviews.Content: The design of lumia is good, wp8 is simple and I like it. I only need to buy prepaid cards from T-mobile.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumina 521
Reviews.Author: Carolyn R. Johnson "loves shoes"
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this phone. I found it easy to learn and love being able to download my music videos. The size is good for the "mature" eye. Overall I am very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the money!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Never thought I'd buy a Windows product, but I must admit, for the money this is a really good phone!  So easy to use for the novice smart phone user.  I wish it worked with my Lexus's USB port, but it doesn't.  That's the only drawback and the reason I gave it four stars instead of five.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: vishwadeep saxena
Reviews.Content: it is more than worth of money it costs. you will never repent buying it. good battery, with all needed apps.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: River2012
Reviews.Content: I've been using this phone for 3 days now and I absolutely love it. If you're looking for a smartphone that isn't bogged down by a ton of extra and unnecessary junk, you'll be very pleased. Clean and simple layout. Great call quality. Very quick and responsive. All for $130. Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: Value for Money
Reviews.Author: Akshay
Reviews.Content: The only thing i lagging is lack of Apps, but you won't fill that as Nokia has come up with there apps which fills up the gap. Best thing is offline map which make it worth deal, instead of buying 100$ GPS just use this phone as GPS :)

Reviews.Title: great phone priced fairly$
Reviews.Author: John B. Bautista "John"
Reviews.Content: I love this phone. It is responsive and quick. The display is clear and the sound is good. The windows 8 tile set up is awesome and makes the phone even more beautiful! The reason why I gave a 4star because there is not much choice of apps and no front facing camera. Other than that it is still a great phone priced right!

Reviews.Title: Multiple issues, but mostly build quality
Reviews.Author: Madmallard
Reviews.Content: My primary problem is that i seem to have one of the bad ones that reboots. As near as i can tell, its because the battery is losing contact upon shock, or even a gentle squeeze in your hand. I have other issues, too, which I'll list, but this first one is the deal breaker, everything else is just for information purposes for others.CONS.The capacitance of the screen is too high for me. I have been using the touch features, but the sensitivity is so great, i've 'floated' my finger near the screen without touching, and the phone counted it as a touch.The camera's LUX/low light sensitivity is TERRIBLE. Pictures indoors after dusk will be all but useless without major ambient light.It also has no notification LED to let you know if a txt is waiting, and the Windows buttons are not back-lit and impossible to see in the dark.Apparently, the hardware for the sound in this phone is a budget chip that has no hardware supported features like DSP and EQ. No app exists for EQ of sound either. Thats really sad considering even cheap Symbian phones from Nokia of before could do that. This phone even uses the same battery as the Nokia Nuron.I didn't realise how much i miss a 'click' vibrate when typing a touch keyboard. this phone does not have such a thing.At least half of the phones STOCK functions do not tilt into horizontal mode, including the navigation map, this is highly annoying. Also, generally speaking, the phone's UI is a bit difficult to navigate without looking directly at it. I noticed this while driving that i could operate my previous phone without looking at it and not have to look away from the road.There is also a general design paradigm problem I have with Windows Phone as a platform.This phone's UI flys in the face of 30 years of cellphone design. when the phone rings, most phones offer a green answer button, and a red hangup/goto VM button. not Windows phone. the answer button takes on the colour of whatever 'theme' colour you've set.The Modus operandii as I have come to find in using WP is that Microsoft wants you to replace/overwrite existing programs, accounts, and apps that you use in an effort to unify your experience in WP.  This is so that Microsoft can link all of your activities together in order to track your usage habits more accurately. This is basically the same as Google forcing people to create a Google+ account in order to be allowed to use Youtube features.The goal of both companies is the same, to track your habits and use the data for marketing. No matter how anonymous Microsoft and Google assure me such info gathering is, and that it is forced compliance to use their technology, doesn't mean I like it.example: the Skype app for WP rejects any existing accounts you have and wants you to create a new account with Microsoft. only then are you permitted to 'link' your existing account to the newly forced Microsoft account.this process serves Microsoft far more than it serves you as a user, because Microsoft now ties all your usage of Skype to all your other activities online to build more usable profile about your habits.If you install an SD card, WP wants to 'sync' your data with a backup cloud and refuses to simply browse the contents of the card. There is no 'file manager' to browse the contents of an SD card.  The WP system is setup so that all apps can only access their own storage thats set aside. While this has the potential to greatly increase security, the way its implemented completely hamstrings what most think to be a very common phone feature. Even 3rd party file managers that you may download are restricted by WP to not allow access to a 'music' or 'document' folder on your SD card.Many applications that came with the phone demand location services that have no business needed to know where you're at.  Calender, games, help & tips, and others.that being said, the system isn't bad, but it isn't for everyone. if you've already given in to super integration and forced compliance with tracking, you won't care even a little bit about what I've pointed out.EDIT:Additional problems have appeared. For one, even when it has full connectivity with 4g coverage, it REFUSES to connect to service until I disable the connection (airplane mode or reboot) and reconnect it. This only affects voice service, data still functions perfectly, leaving me to think its not a service issue.also, the voice to text feature requires network access to work. That means they are downloading every voice to text message you make, analysing it remotely and sending you back what they think you said.  That means they're keeping every recording you make...

Reviews.Title: My First Windows Phone
Reviews.Author: squinky86
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nokia Lumia 521 to get into the world of Windows Phone App development, but have found that I quickly need to get out.THE GOOD:* The phone is fast. With half the processor of the Android phone it was replacing, it still feels like a hardware upgrade.* The interface is intuitive - the tiles afford no explanation to figure out what each one does. It's very easy to use this phone.* The price is good.* T-mobile wifi calling.* Sturdy construction; this phone should last you for a while.THE BAD:* Apps. There aren't any really good ones.* The ability to make apps on this phone has been CRIPPLED with the version 8 update.  - Do you want to record a phone call? You can no longer do that because Microsoft makes it so that you can't access the microphone while in the middle of a call.  - Do you want to build an app that manages wireless connections? Too bad - the wireless interface is completely inaccessible form code.  - Do you want to change your default keyboard? Sorry - Microsoft says you have to stick with theirs.* No flash (camera and browser), but already knew that before buying.* Try plugging your phone into your Windows 8 computer with the Windows 8 Phone app up while an sd card is plugged into your phone... oh, you aren't allowed to access the phone while an sd card is in use? I have to turn off my phone and use an sd card reader just to get images off my card.* Wifi calling does not switch between wifi and cell zones as seamlessly as the Android app does. It takes nearly a full minute once you've left wifi coverage before the app will give up and switch you back to cell coverage.* EDIT: When wifi calling is enabled, you cannot receive MMS (multi-media messages). They won't download properly, and t-mo won't let you change the bad settings to get them (this is a wifi calling app problem with t-mobile). Every time the download of the MMS fails, you receive a new text alert even though you don't have a new message.THE UGLY:* Google is blocking access to the API key that Microsoft uses for the Youtube app, making the default youtube application unusable. Google - you don't make an API key and then complain when someone uses data from it to build an app. Microsoft - you don't change Google's advertising code provided by the API. Both companies - get your act together!!!THE BOTTOM LINE:I highly recommend this phone if you want a fast little smart phone capable of calling, browsing the web, and staying connected with friends. If you are a power user that wants to record calls, do massive amounts of texting, or build your own applications - the iOS and Android platforms are leaps and bounds beyond what Windows is even capable of doing. Until Microsoft gives developers the ability to create powerful and usable apps on their platform, the Windows Phones will forever be in the realm of low-end smartphones that aren't capable of reaching the complexity and power provided by the iOS and Android platforms.Final rating - 2 stars. Unusable for my needs, but may serve others' well enough. I miss my Android phone...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Bang for the Buck but UI Issues
Reviews.Author: Trevor L "God is on the side of the army with...
Reviews.Content: I've recently used all the major types of phones - iPhone, Android and event Blackberry.  This is my first Windows Phone (8.0). The phone is pretty easy to set up.  I had GMail, Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn set up in minutes. The phone is extremely responsive and it recognized my 16GB mircoSD card.After a few minutes a few things stood out as troublesome:* The user interface wastes a lot of screen real estate. For instance in the "news" social update app almost the top 1/4 of the screen is taken up with huge words. The UI relies on font size and color way too much.  The screen real estate is not big enough for that layout.* You can only choose two background colors: black or grey. Black is too hard to sort out content and gray is annoying.* The power status not displayed by default.  I'm always paranoid about power level and having to swipe to see it is annoying. I turned on "Battery Saver" just in case.* Setup defaults to the least private options. both Nokia and Microsoft seem to want to track everything I do.* The music app doesn't have a mode to browse by file hierarchy. Id you load up mp3 files organized by folders on the microSD it isn't possible to easily select them individually.* Many important apps aren't pinned to the start page by default and a lot of useless ones are.* Setup seems to connect you to Facebook but you need to download the app to really read posts. The pictures in the news section are far too small.* No option to display text messages on the swipe screen.

Reviews.Title: Great value, but BEWARE: faulty headphone jack breaks easily, and Nokia support is of no help!
Reviews.Author: LucaR
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone about 4-5 months ago and I've been happy with it as a phone. The battery life is good, it's zippy and relatively lag-free, especially given its pedestrian hardware, and I like the Windows Phone OS. The speaker is also loud as others have mentioned. The screen isn't the greatest, but given the price, it's hard to hate anything about this phone.Well, except one thing. The headphone jack! Under normal use, my headphone jack got "loose" after about 2 months, causing the audio to cut in and out whenever the cord brushed up against something. The problem got progressively worse until I gave up and mailed it to Nokia support.They sent me back my phone without any changes. They didn't fix the problem! What horrible service. And now my friend who has the same phone tells me his headphone jack is cutting out as well.As far as I can tell, this phone has a FLAWED design. I'm not sure I even want to bother trying to send it back to Nokia - even if they do bother fixing it, it'll probably just break again in a few months.For those who listen to music or podcasts on your phone - better invest in a set of bluetooth headphones if you buy this phone. Not quite the deal that it looks like.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone, But BEWARE - May Only Be Activated on Prepaid Plans
Reviews.Author: M. Johnston
Reviews.Content: Since Apple effectively bricked my formerly working iPhone 4 with the release of iOS 7, I became a refuge and ran into the warm, welcoming arms of Nokia. So far, I have not been disappointed with these phones, though I admit to having held my nose at the thought of switching to a Windows-based anything. From everything I've seen so far, at under $100, these are an excellent bargain.My gripe is not with the phone. Rather, it is with the product description, which is comically inadequate for an Amazon-sold item. I offer a warning to all those buying this phone who plan on subscribing to T-Mobile with anything other than a prepaid plan: it won't work - at least not until you buy new sim cards, for those included with this product may only be activated on T-Mobile's prepaid plans.  Anything else, such as the family plan I wanted to signup for,  will require that you purchase a new sim card. Unfortunately, Amazon's description doesn't mention that, and the signup sheet that comes with the phone doesn't make it clear either. So pity me, spending  3 hours  bouncing from person to person at T-Mobile for an explanation of how to get the 2 phones I purchased setup. Finally, I had a moment of inspired genius and simply called their sales line to get an answer.So is the phone worth the money? Absolutely. In fact, it's probably worth more than you'll pay for it. But Amazon's sorry product description has left me with a sour taste in my mouth that I don't usually have when buying from them. I'm out $22 for new sim cards, plus the 3 hours I spent that I could have avoided if only Amazon had mentioned one of the most critical details about this product.UPDATE:I contacted Amazon regarding the product's inadequate description and how it had caused me (and probably others) to waste so much time trying to activate a phone with a sim wholly unsuited to anything but use on a prepaid plan. Credit them with doing the right thing. They acknowledged the problem, extended a refund to me for the cost of two sim cards and said the catalog team had been notified and the description would be updated.

Reviews.Title: good for the price; bad for the build
Reviews.Author: huaping mo
Reviews.Content: very good price for a smart phone.I bought the same model about 8 months ago, but now the power switch is barely working. wifi calling keeps taking over at home and prevents multimedia messaging.other points: wp is not as efficient as iphone; needs reboot more often (just like PC's).

Reviews.Title: Ordered two and neither of them worked.
Reviews.Author: Krista Ward
Reviews.Content: Ordered two of these phones.  Both showed up in T-Mobile packaging, and looked great. Nothing wrong there. It wasn't until a few days later that my phone started turning off on it's own even though the battery was fully charged.  Then my husband's phone started having problems too.  He would go to call someone and the phone would just not do the call. He would have to take his battery out and put it back in in order for it  to make calls.Overall very disappointing.  :(  We were really hoping to save a few bucks with these phones but we're coming the realization that sometimes things really are too good to be true.  It's almost impossible to have a good phone at a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: 4G Rarely works.
Reviews.Author: Titinetnet
Reviews.Content: This phone does not work in 4G mode. I had one previously that worked fine. I had to call TMobile and.add codes . It is usually in 2 G mode and drops calls. The only redeeming feature is the camera which is excellent. That is the only reason it has 2 stars. I had one Nokia Lumia that worked fine and one that doesn't. Also TMobile was if little help. I am still waiting on them to call me back. I am not satisfied this time !

Reviews.Title: Wrong button placement!hot and low battery life
Reviews.Author: Ebony Stokes
Reviews.Content: This is my second Windows phone. I had a Nokia Lumia 710 which I gave to my husband. This phone is thinner with a bigger screen. The camera takes decent low light pictures. I wish it had a flash and a front facing camera. I use the phone often with just my right hand because I have a newborn. The power button is accidently pressed all the time. Very frustrating. Also the battery life on my two years old 710 is still better than the battery life on my brand new 521. The battery also gets super hot after a short time. I really want to like this phone, but I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Giftable
Reviews.Author: Bonie
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a gift to my pastor and he loves it. I would buy another one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Phone defective
Reviews.Author: Quanda Littles
Reviews.Content: Phone new in box but will not connect to network appears defective.had to purchase another phone since could not get this phone to work.

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: Yakanu Prosper
Reviews.Content: This is a nice product just that it was not decoded so I couldn't use it when I travelled to Africa. I called t-mobile to decode it, but they refused to do that.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 521 Review
Reviews.Author: onL0oker
Reviews.Content: Received the phone on time and in working order.  It's a good phone with great features.  Would like a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Good quality Nokia Lumia
Reviews.Author: C. Debelen
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift to my wife. It's been about six months and still going. she is happy, but too much time is spent on the internet.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: My family loves this phone!  Our sons are hard on their cell phones. We have two Nokia 521's for our teenagers who are always online using you tube etc... We have had them since December and they work great! The phone processes data fast and they never have had a single problem with it. Our teenagers are boys who are always dropping their phones (not recommended..lol) but so far they are working fantastic.  They have games and music downloaded on them and have replaced using their ipods with it just so they can only carry one item.  If you are looking for a phone for yourself or a teenager this one is great!

Reviews.Title: I thought this would be better
Reviews.Author: ai chan1
Reviews.Content: I had been using the Windows 7 entry Nokia 710 for the past 2-3 years  and now the battery is starting not to charge up well. Its a great entre level windows phone , easy to use and quick. Its only 2 drawback was the font size cannot be adjusted and its not birght enough for outside use.Then I bought the 521 a few months when it first came out and I finally get to use it, April 2014.1 .I noticed the phone gets really hot.2. The the screen would turn off even when  I am trying to call out and then the power/screen  button is intermitent working 3. the Speaker is really muffled and has a high tone level4. My Voice comes out muffled on the recieving endI compared this to the 710 and sound on that phone is much much better. The 521  screen is a little bigger and  brighter but still not bright enough.Plan:  I am going to get rid of this phone since this one is annoying me . I need a phone with better mic and speaker since I use the speakerphone a lot.  I will get the next model up or so.

Reviews.Title: Windows Phone
Reviews.Author: April Davis
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a new phone but didn't want to spend an arm and leg. I went on amazon and all my needs were met. I was able to get a new phone, case, and screen cover all in a couple minutes. The next week I was receiving everything.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!
Reviews.Author: mandi
Reviews.Content: this is such a wonderful phone!! seriously anyone out there dogging windows phones must be illiterate! i mean yeah it has SOME down points like the microsoft app store SUCKS!! but as for social media and ease of adjusting to it this phone is awesome! me and my husband have the same one now and he normaly only likes the slider phones with the full QWERTY keyboard but even he is adjusting well to this phone! I love the way you can customize the home screen and the phone is plain out LOUD!! like it even gives you a warning that it could cause damage if you turn the volume all the way up with headphones in =]

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: paris jane
Reviews.Content: I'm new to smartphones this is my second  my first was a prism,this one is so far better . this phone is awesome.it does everything .the windows face is great. I would buy this phone again.

Reviews.Title: best phone ever
Reviews.Author: george brassel
Reviews.Content: this phone is wonderful before I got it unlock I could have access the internet. And after unlocking it works like a charm no complains on my part as yet.....

Reviews.Title: new to this type of phone
Reviews.Author: navybluem
Reviews.Content: Probably me because I am not a guru..Had problems loading and ended up at Tmobile to fix it.works good otherwise

Reviews.Title: Cheap and Great for Beginners
Reviews.Author: Phu H.
Reviews.Content: Just decided to leave the very old cell phone age and jump into the iPhone, Window phone, Smart Phone, Android Phone, etc age.  It's cheap and simple to use, a great phone for newbies.  With a good protection case on, my cheap phone looks and feel like a $300+ phone.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone!
Reviews.Author: Jayant
Reviews.Content: I like that I can customize it based on what I want. I have small hands so it is a little big and light, but I plan to buy a case to hopefully make it a little bulkier so it fits in my hand better. Battery life is great and camera takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Affordable phone with nice features.
Reviews.Author: Allan Pudlitzke
Reviews.Content: The phone is very affordable for what it has to offer as an entry level smartphone. would be great for kids and/or just for use as an MP3 player with its Expandable memory slot.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Maya
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my first phone and I really like it!! It is not to big or small and it feels perfect in my hands. I like the white color as well as the fact that there are many cases for it. Over all it is a great phone!

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 521 (T. Mobile)
Reviews.Author: John D. O. Okundolor
Reviews.Content: I Love this product, Its so beautiful, and it came in as estimated by the seller. Thanks. I reccomend it to any one who want to buy for personal use or as a gift for some one else..

Reviews.Title: Very Smart Phone For A Very Smart Price!
Reviews.Author: Manny105
Reviews.Content: Windows phones rock! Don't tell anyone. Easy to set up and easy to use! One of the best kept secrets ever.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone
Reviews.Author: AnAnastasia
Reviews.Content: I love the phone.My Samsung Galaxy S4 had an unfortunate accident and drowned in the washing machine. I was just looking for a cheap smart phone that I could use in the mean while. I am very impressed, it's not quite a Galaxy S4 but then again it is a generation older. There is just one problem I have with the phone, it's. Camera is very bad and has no flash. I knew this before I bought it. It would be a stellar phone if it's camera and flash was upgraded. It is user friendly and has an awesome interface that is personalized.

Reviews.Title: What a pleasant surprise
Reviews.Author: Muhammad Adnan
Reviews.Content: It was actually a backup phone just in case if I lose my primary Samsung GS2. I am glad I gave it a go one day and it worked seamlessly since then (two months). Battery life is pretty good so is the signal reception compared to S2. Touch screen display was very very responsive.ON TOP of everything else, the price was phenomenal. There is no way you can get this quality phone for this much price.Now this has become my primary phone :-D

Reviews.Title: It was so nice, I bought it twice!
Reviews.Author: Dannis Byers
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for myself a few months ago.  I absolutely love it.  My husband started playing with my Nokia Lumina 521 before Christmas.  To keep my phone from disappearing into his custody (never to be seen again)  I bought him his very own Lumina 521.  Now we are both happy happy happy!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: devin warren
Reviews.Content: This is the first phone and it has a reasonable price$89.96! The only bad thing about it is that every time I drop it it turns of immediately.overall pretty good:-)

Reviews.Title: First smartphone
Reviews.Author: S. Lapolla
Reviews.Content: I have a tmobile family plan and I purchased this for myself. My husband has an iPhone, but I couldn't justify the price. I need a phone to call, text, and give me directions when I need them. This phone seems to fit the bill.When I received the package I opened it and realized that my current SIM card was not the same size as the nokia. I went to Tmobile and they activated the new SIM card and transferred all data from the old SIM card and turned on my new phone. Well, it wouldn't go past the Tmobile screen. The rep said he hoped I saved my receipt. I was disappointed, not only my first smartphone, but my first phone purchased from Amazon.  I took the phone home turning it off and on and hoping for a different outcome. I searched comments for freezing and FAQ on Nokia website. I was about to do a hard reset and plugged it in. While I was searching online my phone starting making noises. Apparently all it needed was a little charging. It has worked well since then.Now I am getting an error message that there may be something wrong with the SIM card, but it has not affected performance.Overall, I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: exactly what I wanted from a smart phone
Reviews.Author: Rajeev Varma
Reviews.Content: not too costly, supports most features required in a SMART phone and battery life is decent to say the least.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: msadriane
Reviews.Content: Great price, got it as a gift for someone. Got it just in time for Valentines day � it was also brand new in the box

Reviews.Title: love the phone
Reviews.Author: mellymel
Reviews.Content: I wasn't to convince at first,but I really like my phone. IT has everything I want on a phone . I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: This phone ROCKS!
Reviews.Author: Bradley G.
Reviews.Content: The Nokia Lumia 521 is an amazing device that is simple to use, yet elegant enough to do complex tasks. I LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Good overall phone, but not good reception at my home compared to Galaxy S.
Reviews.Author: Dave Dutson
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my wife for a Christmas present, overall easy to use and has some good functionality.  Data is a bit slow and after talking for ten minutes or so, the reception drops out on this phone consistently at my house.  I travel to NJ and work there most of the time and call my wife and kids on a regular basis.  We get talking and then consistently after about ten minutes, the service/reception cuts out.My wife went back to using her Galaxy S phone (3 years old) as the reception is much better at our house.  Too bad, now I have no use for this phone....!

Reviews.Title: Great phone with strange flaws.
Reviews.Author: The charlie on Earth
Reviews.Content: This is a smartphone in the full sense of the word. Don't let the price full ya. Only real flaws are the okay camera and alert sounds. Its usable just not great. I don't think a camera should be added if it had no flash. The software makes up for the flashless camera, but sometimes it is too dark. Another flaw is the lack of alert sounds. You can't add any and the ones it has are generic. My phone has been R2D2 for years this is the first phone I've had that R2D2 has to make a windows sound for text, email, and voicemail. Other than that this phone is great. It is fast, durable, and has a growing apps library with most popular apps. I also really like the GUI. Also this thing plays some amazing games with stunning graphics. I really like trials extreme. It also has wordament, which is a must for me.

Reviews.Title: The best!!!
Reviews.Author: heidi
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this phon. It does pretty much anything a person would want it to do! definately recommend this phone , It is awesome!

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: ramsy
Reviews.Content: I have faced no problems doing good. I had no issues, battery lasts long enough. overall satisfied with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Ken N
Reviews.Content: I love this phone. Beats my last phone by a long shot. Love the Windows Phone system, much better than Android!

Reviews.Title: Preeemo
Reviews.Author: Peyton
Reviews.Content: Does about everything I need it to do, Only has a few glitches but for 80$ im not complaining about it.

Reviews.Title: best t-mobile smartphone for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Slack
Reviews.Content: This is the best t-mobile smartphone for the price! We wanted to try out t-mobile since my wife is a flight attendant. She can use her phone while on her trips to Hong Kong. Seemed to work okay as long as you have added extra money to the account for the 10 cent calls and 20 cent texts.

Reviews.Title: Happy then ended up disapointed
Reviews.Author: JlbMsp
Reviews.Content: Loved it at first.  Then 1 day after the return policy ended, the screen developed a streak of black down the side and lines across the bottom.  It hadn't been dropped, or anything else, so it wasn't due to  human error.  We looked online and it seems this has happened to other Lumia's.  Bummer.Update.... Amazon went the extra mile and is allowing an exchange.  We hope the replacement won't be faulty. Thank you Amazon for all your help!!

Reviews.Title: Ummm, this phone ROCKS!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Gold "bookher"
Reviews.Content: If you are considering this phone - look no further! I've had iPhones and Androids. For the money, this is definitely the way to go! All the things you NEED are on this phone, for 1/10 the price. Navigation is excellent (better than iPhone) it even tells you when you're speeding! The xbox music store has everything iTunes has, and everything is 'free' (unlimited downloads) for $9.99 a month.it has all the apps I use, the camera works GREAT,  memory is expandable, and the battery lasts  FOREVER and charges very quickly. Love it!

Reviews.Title: unlock code
Reviews.Author: poppaiva
Reviews.Content: hi.I need to unlock code for this phone, because i can`t use it in my country.i hope you can help me.please.

Reviews.Title: NOKIA LUMIA 521 T-MOBILE
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: GREAT PHONE FOR OUR PURPOSES.  WOULD BE NICE IF IT HAD A FLASH AND THE SCREEN WAS EASIER TO SEE IN SUNLIGHT.  THE E-INK THAT KINDLE USES IS GREAT IN THE SUNLIGHT.

Reviews.Title: We love Nokia lumia
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone for my 13 yr old son, I am ordering one for myself tonight, this phone surpassed our expectations, the operating system, the user interface left my iPhone in the dust, I love the apps the endless possibilities of Nokia lumia, the camera is awesome, the windows 8, And Xbox my son loves this phone and so do I.

Reviews.Title: Battery shortlife
Reviews.Author: Burntfoot
Reviews.Content: I love the phone! After 6 years, I get to finally changed my old one. The first one was only given and this is the first time that I bought one for myself. I have been eyeing on this one from Wal-Mart since summer of last year and waited till it goes on sale. However, the MS store had it on sale first so I bought it there. I returned it though after not being able to figure out how to insert the sim card properly (silly me).  Then I saw in Amazon that this phone was on sale at a much cheaper price than MS Store so I bought it right away. My only issue about the phone is the battery. It doesn't last long. After 2 days I had to charge it again even though I had the battery saver on and I always turn it off during night time and I hardly use it for calling or texting. That is the only bummer about this phone.

Reviews.Title: cell phone
Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: like the way it looks how it handles it is very light i will recommend this phone to friend and foe

Reviews.Title: A gift
Reviews.Author: Kyle J. "KJK2682"
Reviews.Content: this was a gift, I was able to look at it afterwards. decent phone simple to use, the user is still learning how to use smart phones.  if you need something simple for teenagers, or a cheap smartphone, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Patricia Suazo
Reviews.Content: daughter loves the phone.  Ordered due to the inexpensive price and ability to look like a smart phone, but not be a smart phone. We ordered this phone because our 15 year old didn't need internet access, but wanted a nicer phone.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 521
Reviews.Author: Hemayet Thakur
Reviews.Content: This is a good set. Multi function with a reasonable price. Very light easy to carry. We are happy.. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Great for seniors
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: I got this for my dad. He's not technical and he doesn't care about installing more apps.[Good]Easy to Use: Just as intuitive as iPhone. In some ways it's even easier to use.Original and innovative UI: Unlike other mobile operating systems, it doesn't feel like a cheap copy of iOS. The Windows 8 tile UI is innovative and just plain nice. Of course like everything else not everyone will like it but it's original.The Best for the Vision Impaired: All text can be made bigger. Also, unlike iOS you can even resize buttons on the Home Screen. It even has a high contrast option. In my opinion this is the best for people who can't see very well.Cheap: You can't beat the value. It's stylish, functional, fast, and it's at a low price point.Pay as You Go: It's compatible with pay as you go plans.
