I'd say the Lumia's are the best phones for those plans if the iPhones aren't available.(T-Mobile only I think) Wi-fi Enabled Calling: On T-Mobile, if you have access to wireless internet; calls won't count against your minutes.It has all the core apps that you need: Email, Facebook, Skype, Twitter, a Web Browser, and more.Decent Camera: It's 5 MP. For the price, it's not bad.Expandable to 64 GB: You can add extra SD storage up to 64 GB.Good Performance: Pretty fast and I rarely noticed any lag. Then again I didn't even try playing games on it, even though Angry Birds is included on the phone.Good Facebook Integration: The phone seamlessly merges everything on your Facebook into all parts of the phone. i.e. All of your phone contacts will have extra data like pictures and email pulled from Facebook, making it one of the nicest phone contact UIs found on a smartphone.Good MS Services Integration: The phone seamlessly works with everything Microsoft like Skydrive and Skype.[Bad]There are very few apps compared to either Android or iPhone. Thankfully the main ones like Facebook, Skype, Google Maps, Viber, and What's App are available. If you like apps, this isn't the phone to get.Build Quality: While the front of the phone is nice, the back of it is all cheap plastic. I don't mind since it's a cheap phone.No Camera Flash: Pictures with poor lighting will not turn out well. It's an understandable sacrifice for the price.No Front Camera: You're not going to be able to use this for video chatting with Skype. It's understandable for the price.Extra SD storage can only be used by pictures, videos, and music: Apps are only limited to the 4 GB of storage that the phone comes with (yes it's really 8GB but the Windows 8 OS itself uses up 4 GB of it so you only have 4GB left to use). Only the videos and pictures that you take, and the music that you add can use the extra storage. This would be really bad if Windows 8 had a lot of apps. Fortunately (and unfortunately) there aren't very many apps on Windows 8 Mobile.Call Quality: It's horrible isn't great when it's not on speaker phone. Even when the volumed is maxed, I can barely hear anything.[Verdict]Personally I'm sticking to an iPhone for myself. If you're younger AND open to new tech then iOS or Android is for you. If you don't care about the latest apps and games or are firmly into Windows, this is a really great starter smartphone at a low price.This phone is just really awesome for the elderly.

Reviews.Title: If there exists a better smart phone deal...
Reviews.Author: Centauri "Centauri"
Reviews.Content: ...I'd love for somebody to shine a light on it, because it must exist in some dark corner somewhere. The 520/521 is frequently pitched as a first or backup smartphone, but I'm pretty sure those words are coming from the carriers themselves who don't want you to realize that this device is as good for your day to day needs as anything you can buy for 5x the price. Its specs might not look like anything to write home about, but Windows Phone is as frugal as any modern OS I've ever seen; you'd need 4x the computational power to get Android to move its butt as quickly as WP8 moves on this entry level device.

Reviews.Title: Decent Temporary Phone
Reviews.Author: Hunter Williams
Reviews.Content: Decently quick. Sometimes freezes up on me but a quick removal of the battery gets it to turn back on. Not fancy but gets the job done. Sweet camera options but the camera is awful. Probably won't get another Windows phone, I just prefer Android or IOS, but it's a nice, cheap temporary phone.Screen is also not very durable. I dropped it and the bottom corner of the screen cracked and is beginning to spider. Granted, I probably shouldn't have dropped it. But it happens.

Reviews.Title: Get this phone!! You won't be sorry!!!
Reviews.Author: vetteman63
Reviews.Content: One HELL OF A PHONE FOR THE PRICE!! I AM AMAZED OOF THE GQALITY FOR SUCH A LOW PRICE!!! THE VETTEMAN LOVES HIS NORKIA 521......

Reviews.Title: Holiday Express
Reviews.Author: M.DiMarco
Reviews.Content: Amazing Gift-Fast Shipping-Great Quality,Only issue was that the box had a lot of unwanted finger prints.It was a gift, so I wanted it to be a clean package.

Reviews.Title: cell phone
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: I love my new phone. I got it all now but don't know how to use it. Bought a book but that's not real clear. I love the fact I have a 54.00 Bill every month. No hidden fees. Talk text and web.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: The phone is awesome and can do many things other phones can not do. I would recommend this phone to anyone.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Value!
Reviews.Author: Rich Hatfield
Reviews.Content: An excellent value!  I researched all No Contract phones available for T-Mobile and nothing compares to the Nokia Lumia 521 at this price level.  I switched from an Android phone a month ago, and here's what I've found.  The included apps do a nice job, once you learn how to utilize them.  Call clarity is excellent, and Live Tiles can be configured to show much information on the Home Screen.  However, there are far more Android apps than Windows Phone apps.  Also, Microsoft, in their infinite wisdom, does not allow third party developers to access or change certain features, such as setting separate volume levels for different functions(Ringer, Music, etc.).  At the end of the day, this is a great phone for the money, and I won't have a stroke if it gets broken.

Reviews.Title: Solid off-contract phone!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good off-contract phone. The price is right, delivery was prompt, and worked right out of the box.PROS:- Speaker is really loud when you play music.- Takes good pictures.CONS:- Doesn't upgrade to windows 8.1. It comes with windows 8.0, which is not the latest.- The sensitivity of the display is good, but I mistype a little more ofthen that I did with similar HTC ONE Windows phone I had before.- Plastic back seem cheap.

Reviews.Title: Excelent value for a basic smart phone.
Reviews.Author: Sunny Jim
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone for the money. Looks a little cheap, but the right case and screen protector are great enhancements that will protect it and make it look better, with very little extra money.It replaced a T-Mobile Samsung Gravity Smart with keyboard that broke down after exactly two years. This Nokia 521 seems to be a better phone.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for the price...
Reviews.Author: Peter Buu To
Reviews.Content: Little light weight, not a solid built but functioning is very good, anything you wanted is there, good wi-fi, speakers...

Reviews.Title: Like it!
Reviews.Author: Tyche
Reviews.Content: I have never used win8 system. It is amazing!!! I like it!!!! 100$ is totally worth it! And its battery is good.

Reviews.Title: nokia 521
Reviews.Author: cherriepie
Reviews.Content: I love my phone its easy to download music and the sounds are great I would recommend this phone its great

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Phone at good price...
Reviews.Author: Nachiket Bhide
Reviews.Content: Even though its smart phone its not at all complicated....Nokia has made a point by keeping service item description simple and easy to understand. User can easily navigate as it talks only about what you want as a user and don't end up in jungle of apps..or Newly formed Jargons...Very nice phone for calling and text (basics of phone are too good), good battery time, excellent GPS, easy to handle, nice camera, Great Processing speed....takes on heavy data load easily...

Reviews.Title: Smart phone, great price
Reviews.Author: Gregory Chernis
Reviews.Content: I had an HTC 8X that had to be replaced due to frequent lock-ups.  Nokia 521 is not as awesome on the features, but it seems reliable from a week's use.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little phone
Reviews.Author: R. Baker
Reviews.Content: Arrived next day unexpectedly fast.  Easy setup and configuration.  Cannot say enough about this phone.  Full of features, the only thing lacking is the front facing camera which I would probably never use anyway.

Reviews.Title: My new phone
Reviews.Author: M82
Reviews.Content: The phone works great so far. Windows 8 Mobile works smoothly and, although it does not come with the full applications that the bigger Lumia phones have (i.e.: Creative Studio), it comes with everything that I need in a phone, for a great price

Reviews.Title: BANG for your BUCK!
Reviews.Author: CheersMate
Reviews.Content: Hands down no question you won't find another phone with the build quality, manufacture support, a very powerful and fluid operating system, with an incredible bargain price then the Nokia Lumia 521. At this price a low in Android is buggy and cheaply build compare to the Lumia 521. This phone can be used as an in between phone and at the same time a primary phone.With Windows Phone ever expanding QUALITY app store, the "lack of apps" conversation is a thing of the past.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Mkr
Reviews.Content: This no doubt is a great phone for the price. It's easy to setup (including your personal & office emails), has a good camera and wifi calling features.

Reviews.Title: OMG
Reviews.Author: PSD1
Reviews.Content: LOve it! worth every penny! better than my old phone i bought for 600!! Ive had it for a couple of days and i am very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: SIMPLY THE BEST!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone few days ago for my wife and we're all loving it like anything. I like its keyboard better than my iphone. Its WiFi calling feature is awesome - I live in a place we signal drops to 1-2 bars and this feature is amazing, you could tell the difference. The other feature that my wife is impressed about is "kids corner" as my 2.5 year old loves to play with phone and mess up with its setting, this feature limits that. Its a good looking phone with some great features, Nokia used good material too as you could tell from holding it - it doesn't look like a cheap phone at all.

Reviews.Title: Good phone but
Reviews.Author: gbrown
Reviews.Content: Don't count on t-mobile to unlock it.  They have published unlocking conditions, but my experience suggests you can meet all their terms and they will still refuse to provide the unlocking code for this phone.

Reviews.Title: WOW, WOW, WOW, Seriuosly, WOW!!!
Reviews.Author: Ram Wats "Ram Wat"
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe what I got.This is like a dream come true.An excellent phone at an EXCELLENT PRICE!!!Love my new phone, just love it!Its Camera, Video, Music, Apps, Battery Life, OS, etc. are INCREDIBLE!!!Thanks Nokia, and thanks LUMIA!!!A dream come true!!!! :))))))))0

Reviews.Title: A great phone for talk & text & music, but not much else
Reviews.Author: ariel
Reviews.Content: I really like the look of this phone and nokia has always made their phones very durable. I got this phone refurbished so some of my critiques may be due to extended misuse.Pros:The call quality was really good and exceeded the iphone in many ways. For the first time I could actually have a clear conversation and the speaker phone was of equal quality.There seems to be more storage on this camera than other phones, which makes it great for holding music, games, and pictures.Everything is on the front screen, but sometimes it can feel overwhelming the first time you use it. after awhile, you get use to it.Cons:The touch calibration on the phone was a little sensitive and you can adjust it in the settings, but I noticed that even after adjusting it, the phone was still difficult to navigate through.I noticed that most of the apps I use on a daily basis (banking, social media, and email) were a little dull and not rated highly in the app store. The quality of the apps were extremely slow, but I found that using the internet explorer was a little faster than using the actual app.The camera on the nokia is really bad. It is extremely grainy and even worse in low light settings. I have been spoiled by the iphone camera and I have become very reliant on a quality camera.I hope this helps. I would recommend this phone to someone who likes to talk and text, but if you have an online business or are internet famous, then this phone will drive you crazy.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 521
Reviews.Author: Rose M. Norman-Gates
Reviews.Content: I like the cell phone; it has a lot options. But it is very complicated to use. the touch pad is to sensitive. Adding contact is rather unfriendly. I would like to change my front to a picture from bing - will not let me do this.I expected it to be more user friendly.Rose

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Unlocked it work's on AT&T;
Reviews.Author: Mike Gill
Reviews.Content: It's a great deal for the $80 I paid for it. My goal was to get it unlocked for use on AT&T.; This phone *is* locked to T-Mobile. I have a friend that uses T-Mobile even though it's contract free, so I was able to put his SIM card in my phone once per day for about 8 days. Each time I made one call and sent once text, then put his SIM back into his phone. T-Mobile says you need to do this so the phone shows up in their system. They say you need to do this for seven days. I didn't do it for seven days straight, but after eight days or so, I had done this at least six times. I had no trouble getting them to email the unlock code to my friend, then he forwarded to me.Now, WHY did I do this when the AT&T; Nokia 520 is cheaper? Because the T-Mobile phone doesn't automatically come up in their database when it connects. They don't know it's a smartphone as long as I have cell data and location services turned off. So I don't have to pay the mandatory data charge. I have had a non-AT&T; branded Android phone like this as well for over a year on AT&T; and only pay $10/mo on my fam plan for it. WiFi is good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: Yes it is locked. It works with some minor issues. FANTASTIC phone though.
Reviews.Author: Zafirah Khan
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a locked phone. You can unlock it using [...] it takes about 15 working days to get the code. One issue with this phone, is the battery. Not sure what is the cause but the battery is not large enough to reach the 3 pins in the phone. So it blinks (charging) all never charges. You need to put a folded piece of paper under the battery to raise it to the points. After this it works fine. Great phone for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good for price, music player is buggy
Reviews.Author: mrwaterskiiing
Reviews.Content: Phone works well especially for the price.  Biggest problem is the music player will just stop playing and you need to do a hard restart to fix.  Seems to be caused by other programs processing data, even in the background.  I've tried to find alternative music players that will work better but they all seem to have the same issue.  No flash means no flashlight function which is unfortunate.  No silence button so you have to go through the settings function to silence and unsilence the ringer.  For now, quite a few of the iphone apps I used do not have a windows version yet.  However, no other smartphone on the market for anywhere near this price so still the best option if you just cannot bring yourself to spend hundreds of dollars on a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: nice phone, but hey watchout.. it doesn't come with headphones
Reviews.Author: charudut
Reviews.Content: I really love the phone, for this price its a deal! While I like the phone there is something about the package as a whole which I personally don't like. You have seen those awesome headphones with Lumia which is not included along with this purchase. Surprised? So was I when I dint find them. When I checked with T-Mobile I was told this was done on purpose! So watch out, T-Mobile  took your headphones away so that you buy it separately as an accessory from their store.

Reviews.Title: Great phone... for its price
Reviews.Author: emag
Reviews.Content: The Lumia 521 is a great phone for its price... but it's a $100 smartphone, and corners were very obviously cut. If you're a first time smartphone buyer, you may not know what you're missing, but if you're a Android (Nexus) or iOS user, you'll definitely feel the downgrade.I've had the device for about three months now, and I'd like to share my observations.Pros:+The WP8 layout/style is appealing+Performance/responsiveness is solid (especially compared to Android devices)+Idle/low-use battery life is great+Nokia Music offers ad-free streaming music+Nice physical construction+Simple, expandable storage+Live tiles bring the best elements of widgets into a sane formatCons:-Screen is mediocre (resolution and viewing angles are tolerable/sufficient, but not great; a little small; poor contrast/black levels)-App support is extremely lacking (and free apps are generally ad-riddled)-Internet Explorer/UC Browser can't handle large/multiple web pages, and Opera Mini isn't available-Music/podcasting support is very poor (no gapless playback, regardless of app; no playback speed adjustment; built-in podcast support is weak and other podcast apps cannot automatically update; playlist support needs to improve)-Lack of Google services/support, even using Internet Explorer-Scrolling vertically through the homescreen to get to apps/live tiles is cumbersome-Multitasking is quite limited; most apps require a lengthy resume process upon switching-Active/moderate usage drains battery fast (note that there's a bug in Internet Explorer that will let it keep running scripts even if it is closed)-There's a dedicated hardware Bing! buttonWishlist: I'd love for Microsoft to offer some better app organization (e.g., horizontally scrolling hub-style home screen), a better core media app (gapless playback, simplified design, sane podcast management), and switch the search button back to fast, context-sensitive searches (with a long-press for full Bing) in WP8.1.Overall: I'm using the Lumia 521 primarily for media playback (while at the gym or on the go) and as a quick-reference second screen, and it's mostly fine for those purposes (with the caveats listed above). It's a huge step down from iOS in terms of apps, though -- not only are games right out, but banking apps, city services (paying parking meter fare, etc.), hobby/website apps, GMail, Pulse, Opera Mini and the like are also unavailable and the closest equivalents/workarounds are a tremendous downgrade. Overall, I'm still happier with the 521 than I've been with any non-Nexus Android phone/tablet I've owned, and I may very well make it my main phone/portable device if supplemented with a tablet (probably an iPad Mini).In summary, if you're unwilling to spend more than $100 for a smartphone (and can't find a used iPhone 4 or better for that price), the Lumia 521 is the device to get. Just note that it's a big step down from high-end devices (iPhone 4 or better, Nexus 4, HTC One, Galaxy S4/Note 3) and the app ecosystem is much, much worse than what you'd find on iOS or Android.

Reviews.Title: Battery Life
Reviews.Author: c.c.strandberg
Reviews.Content: Quality control must really be bad as of the reviews I read I'm not the only one not liking this phone. One day it will go dead in a few hrs and the next time will last 3 days and I don't use it that much.  T-mobile sent me a new battery that didn't help.  1 day lasted 8hrs and I wasn't using it.  No applications were running as all I use it for is texting and phone and that day didn't use it.  T-mobile send me a replacement which I will start using today but cost me $20.00 to get a new one.  I should have returned it Amazon but like a fool didn't..  Now am stuck with it but maybe the new one will be OK.  I can only hope these days.

Reviews.Title: NOT THE BEST CHOICE:
Reviews.Author: Karen Yates
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone for my daughter a few days ago. The first day it function well, by day two it started turning off by itself, just can't seem to get it to stay on. This item is surely not one of my best purchased.

Reviews.Title: power/battery issue
Reviews.Author: ruth porter
Reviews.Content: From day one the phone would just shut down randomly.  It was brand new and was really hoping  for the best.  Had it checked out and no issue with apps or downloads and no obvious problem with battery, but suspect it was still battery connection issue, but not sure.

Reviews.Title: Encantada
Reviews.Author: Hanoi Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I facina the phone but I can not use it in my country Venezuela and could resolve this issue.I would like a unlock code so you can use here in Venezuela.

Reviews.Title: Good starter phone
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Pink
Reviews.Content: This is a good starter phone. I got it as a cheap replacement when my iphone 3gs finally died. The iphone was slightly more user friendly and of course, there are more and better apps for iphone than windows phones as of now. This phone has gotten some getting used to on how it works and what shortcuts it has (or doesn't) and some of the apps made for windows phones are bad (I hate the available gmail apps). The T-Mobile service is ok, but it's hard for me to comment because since I've gotten this phone I've mostly been on an island off the coast of NC and there is not good service here anyway. I only get 2G here. I don't really like that with the $50 plan you only get 1 gig of 4G per month as I imagine once I leave the island I will go through that pretty quickly. I had straight talk with my iphone and that seemed like a better deal, however, slightly slower. I do like the main screen interface and I do think this would be a good first phone.

Reviews.Title: Basic Phone a Good Price But a Little Hard to Ues.
Reviews.Author: James Briggs
Reviews.Content: It's a little hard to you. Having to go through several screens to make or take a call is tough. It seems I rarely make it to the phone on time. But you can't make a butt call. And for a cheap phone it has a lot of features. A good value.

Reviews.Title: Cheap quick fix, but doesn't last
Reviews.Author: Claudia Denker-Neece "Mom of 3 boys"
Reviews.Content: Great if you like windows phones, but started to have issues with screen after one month and six month in my battery will barely hold a charge

Reviews.Title: Good for what it is
Reviews.Author: S. S.
Reviews.Content: Replaced venerable iPhone 3G. Low promo price ($60) + coupon + Offline GPS pushed it over the edge. Back cover pops out if you drop it, even on carpet. Gets very warm very easily for Asphalt 8.

Reviews.Title: Can not get it to sync with Lotus notes mail
Reviews.Author: Nga Nguyen "Someone in Austin"
Reviews.Content: Wish the window phone would sync with Lotus notes!!! if anyone was able to figure out their, please post the direction....

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: Jit Man Basnet
Reviews.Content: Its cheap. Good sound. Didn't find some of the apps like US Bank, Capitol one, Discover etc in its store.

Reviews.Title: Ok but some flaws
Reviews.Author: William C. MacBlain
Reviews.Content: Very good phone. Durable and is an easily adaptable phone. The only things its missing is apps to SD and swipe texting. Nice integration with Xbox.

Reviews.Title: Great phone at an even better price
Reviews.Author: db
Reviews.Content: Let me say first, that I got this phone on sale for $69.99. That is an insane deal for a phone with a dual core processor, 4G connectivity and a micro SD slot. After my wife dropped her 8x and broke the screen I got her this one as a replacement because it was cheaper than any phone I could find, including used ones. It has exceeded my expectations in pretty much every way.Pros:- It has great hardware for the price, a dual core snapdragon processor and 512 mb of ram is nothing to scoff at in this price range.-Windows 8 is very fluid and snappy, masking the fact that this is a budget phone.-The case is stylish and looks flush to the screen while still being easy to remove-Has a micro SD slot, unlike most windows phones no matter the price range- No features commonly locked by carriers like WiFi calling and tetheringCons:- The screen could be sharper, but what do you expect?- The face gets smudged pretty easily.- it's pretty thick and the case selection is badWindows phones have a distinct advantage in the cheap phone arena because Windows 8 is so light and snappy even low end phones are fast and responsive when running it. Even though this is a budget phone there really isn't any noticeable performance woes. In fact, comparing it to my S3, it's usually keeping up or faster in every day tasks. Obviously the low end specs catch up to it in apps with a high demand such as 3D games, but for day to day internet browsing, streaming, calling and texting it's plenty fast.If you are someone who is looking for a budget phone that can still keep up with the other smart phones, you've found it. The fact that the phone is so cheap OFF CONTRACT is nuts considering even the junkiest of phones are at least $200 off contract at Verizon or Sprint.TIP: Pair this phone with the either of the cheap T mobile prepaid plans for $30 or $50 and you have quite the deal. For me and my wife we pay $60 a month for our service. Compare this to our Verizon contract we ended that cost us $150 with only 2gb of data and phones that would cost $400+ to replace if they broke.

Reviews.Title: I BOUGHT IT FOR A GIFT!!
Reviews.Author: 1989vlz
Reviews.Content: MY FRIEND LOVES IT.... I WAS A LITTLE APPREHENSIVE BECAUSE IS NOT AN ANDROID BUT THIS FUN IS JUST AS GOOD AS AN ANDROID.

Reviews.Title: No memory
Reviews.Author: H. razvi "Photog"
Reviews.Content: I've run into the same problems which I've had with most previous Nokia Smartphones.  After a few months of use I start recieving warnings that the phones memory is low.  When I check the phones memory, it says that most of the phone memory is taken up by "other"You can save photos, videos, and songs on the sd card.  Apps are saved on the phones memory, as well as emails and text messages.I find myself going back to my Nokia Nuron, which has 900 text messages saved on the sd card and no memory problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Good phone but wont work with service
Reviews.Author: Erika larson
Reviews.Content: I really like this phone.  Unfortunately it will not work in Europe which I failed to read reviews and research before buying.  We have German T-mobile and got sent between US and German T-mobile to figure out how to "unlock" etc.  This wasn't the sellers fault it was more of the lack of researching before purchasing.  Good phone though.

Reviews.Title: For Cheap, You May Not Be Able to Do Better
Reviews.Author: Marc Kennedy
Reviews.Content: For the moment we decided to go with the $30/mo T-Mobile prepaid plan from Wal-Mart that comes with 100 min of talk, unlimited text, and 5 GB of data per month. This is the best phone available with that plan under $275.Pros:- Five years ago people would have paid a lot of money for the functionality you get in this phone- This phone from Amazon works with the Wal-Mart plan. This phone is replacing one that got wet and wouldn't text anymore. We just swapped out the SIM card. (Before you do that, make sure to back up your apps to the cloud if you can, then using the Nokia "Transfer My Data" app to transfer your contacts with Bluetooth. Your old phone needs to be functional for this to work).- Unlike Apple products, the virtual keyboard makes it clear when a letter is capitalized.Cons- Nowadays this phone is relatively mediocre- Call quality is ok- Touchscreen is somewhat touchy and the virtual keyboard can be difficult to use- The Wifi calling feature almost never works, and when it's on it interferes with texting- The biggest problem with it is that it's a Windows phone.  The number of apps available for Windows phones is abysmal. Some key apps I would like to have are only on the iPhone and Android.- The phone can apparently function as mobile hotspot, but not on my plan- T-mobile does not have a clear and comprehensive list of what phones will work with our plan

Reviews.Title: Fast delivery
Reviews.Author: dwan mont
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my elderly mother she didn't want any bright colors just something to protect her phone and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: The Windows Store
Reviews.Author: Karey Corbitt
Reviews.Content: Its A great phone everything is perfect for the price. but the app store is troble u cant even get the real fruit ninjia

Reviews.Title: same phone as most retailers sell
Reviews.Author: cf
Reviews.Content: Ok phone for what you pay.  Great for tech impaired. Also good for the features it has preloaded. Check price with you local market

Reviews.Title: Unable to See Screen
Reviews.Author: Gigi
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I had previously liked other Nokia phones I had purchased.  In addition, I thought it was a great price for a smart phone.After using it for a couple of months, I believe I have wasted my money.  My biggest complaint is that the screen is impossible to see when one is outside.  Yes, I changed the background to white, which does make it easier to see.  However, the background on the music player does not change and remains black.  I like to walk outside and listen to music, but unless I play a really long album, I cannot even use it.Needless to say, I will now be getting another mp3 player and using the phone features only.

Reviews.Title: Defective Nokia Lumia 521
Reviews.Author: Justin Bynum
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone before but not from amazon. My first one wouldn't turn on after 6 months of use and still was in good condition. After ordering one from amazon it worked for a few hours and wouldn't turn on after relentless charging hours. I returned it and got my money back.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone
Reviews.Author: Tessa ballard
Reviews.Content: I purchase my phone from amazon it by tmobile I love it and the price is way cheaper then the Tmobile store there price was much more expensive; I got a new phone that was in the original packaging and everything was included.

Reviews.Title: It's surprisingly good for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Meadows "cyfan2000"
Reviews.Content: I want to make it clear that I'm an Android guy and likely will never use a Windows phone. Having said that, this phone is actually pretty good for the price.  It's amazingly responsive.  No new Android phone that I know of would be that "fast" feeling if it was under $100 new.  I played with it for a few days and then gave it to my 13-yr-old son.  He's not that into phones so he was happy to have an upgrade from an old Android phone that had too little memory to download much.  So all-in-all...if you don't care much about what operating system or having all the latest Apps, this is a pretty good, basic device.  If you're a phone power user, I couldn't suggest this.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: VickyLostInNM
Reviews.Content: I use my phone, well, to make phone call and send text messages. Internet is just a bonus, fortunately. This phone is not very stable, whenever I'm browsing anything on IE, it disconnects and restarts the phone. But while I'm talking or texting, I have no issues. I don't use my phone as a game boy either, just read the news and use the nokia gps. If it wasn't for the predictable disconnection, I would give it 5 stars. A new phone should't behave this way, but also I'm tired of returning faulty handsets, because they do not send you a brand new handset, but a reconditioned one, which is always more problematic than the previous one.

Reviews.Title: Problems with battery
Reviews.Author: Cindy Fiore
Reviews.Content: Received the phone and from the first day it would not hold a charge. Had to send it back and purchase a new one at a local retailer for more money. Did not want to wait for a new replacement since a new phone plan had been open for the person the phone was purchased for. No time to wait! The second phone we purchased works great. Had no problems getting a refund.

Reviews.Title: Thoughts on the pros and cons after 6 months of ownership
Reviews.Author: JLJ
Reviews.Content: It's easy to love a phone right out of the box - it's a fun new toy - so I wanted to wait to write this until I had an opportunity to see how the phone really held up.Pros:As others have said, you really cannot beat the features and quality for the price.  This is also an excellent entry level phone for newbies to the smartphone world, and intuitive to use for the less technologically-adept.  Wifi calling works great, particularly since T-mobile doesn't have great coverage everywhere (like inside my house).  You do need to enter a 911 address in your account for it to work (at least that was the case when I did my initial set-up).  Voice quality and volume are quite good.  The best thing about this phone, and Windows phones in general, is the live tiles.  I can't believe how much better this is than those dopey little cartoon icons.  So much more efficient to have information like your local weather forecast and daily appointments at a glance without opening an app!Cons:That said, this is certainly no iphone or samsung galaxy in terms of performance (not a knock - you can't compare a $100 phone with a $600 phone - I just mention this because some reviewers here have indicated that it's better). I won't go into the lack of apps - this has been covered and is a Windows issue, not specific to this phone.  If you're happy with basic apps, you're good to go with this.  I thought I'd get a lot of use out of Nokia Drive, the GPS app, but I've been very disappointed in it.  I have found it inaccurate and even when set to say street names, it's a nightmare trying to follow.  I've gone back to my Garmin for this function.  E-mail is also a little annoying in that it doesn't save e-mails sent from the phone to your yahoo or gmail sent folder due to some sort of folder naming discrepancy.  My biggest issue lately is batter life.  I say lately because initially it was fantastic.  With light use I could go two days on a charge, and even with heavier web surfing and videos I could easily go a full day plus.  In the last few weeks, however, this has deteriorated by a good 50% for no seeming reason.  I've minimized all the apps running in the background and turned off location tracking as has been suggested, but it's only helped slightly.Overall, 6 months later I'm still pleased with my purchase and the value for the money, though disappointed in some of the functions I was looking forward to using. If I could afford to upgrade, I'd probably go with a Samsung Galaxy S4.  But in this price range, I'm still confident this phone can't be beat, particularly with Tmo's $30/ month plan.

Reviews.Title: Nothing much to add, but disappointed by maps and navigation
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a basic phone. However, two years ago, something like this probably would have cost $500 to $600. Overall I'm pretty satisfied with it, especially for the price. The speaker is better than my old phone and voice recognition seems to work well. The screen is fine, but not the newer super duper never break never get fingerprint screens. My main complaint is the maps. It got exists wrong. What I mean is, the directions would say something like "take exit to XXX street" where the actual exit would say something else, like "Highway YY." This could get confusing. It's especially strange since Bing Maps on the web show the directions correctly. Also, in the navigation app, I could not find a way to view the route that it calculated or suggest alternate routes. This is a major drawback as I usually like to look at the direction list when I start the navigation, and sometimes whiles stopped someplace so I can keep track of where I am. Because of this, I downloaded the MapQuest app which seems to work much better.

Reviews.Title: difficult
Reviews.Author: Sylvain Pangou Mbembo
Reviews.Content: unfortunately since  i am back home (my country Gabon), i can't use i. i have to wait up to 3 months to get the code (in order to unlock) from the provider.

Reviews.Title: Great phone at an incredible price point
Reviews.Author: kvn
Reviews.Content: Preface:  Have previously had iPhone and Android(more memory errors for this table).  Android was OK when it did not totally suck.  That was about a 50-50 split.  iPhone was foreign.  Just not right.  Ever.  And Apple nickel and dime you endlessly.  iPhone is a wireless sales device like Kindle.  On to the Windows Phone 8….Pros:Easy learning curve.Nokia online video users guides. (nokiasetup dot com)  Highly recommend you watch it before buying.Very high touch screen sensitivity.  Great resolution.  Excellent keyboard.Light weight (see cons).Great battery life.Very good camera (see cons).Highly customizable.Has Bluetooth transfer app to get data from your old phone.Live Tiles make sense on a touch screen.  They even look good.NO bloat ware.  You can de-crapify your phone without rooting.Do not have to root to get a good operating system (like Android).Automatic handoff from cell tower to wifi.4G!!!  Fast wireless N networking!!!Total voice control including text to voice and voice to text.  Texts come in with voice alert and choice of actions.  Check out nokiasetup dot com>People and Messaging>Voice Text Messaging.  It is awesome!Most importantly – great call quality.PRICE.Cons:Slippery and white, get a case.Plastic screen, get a screen protector.No flash for camera.No give away of the day site (like Amazon offers free apps  for Android).Conclusion:The Nokia 521 is not a cheap phone.  It is a great phone at an incredible price point.  Only shortcoming is the plastic screen, meaning its digitizer (touchscreen) will probably die in 2-4 years.

Reviews.Title: Check other sites for best price.
Reviews.Author: Desreen B
Reviews.Content: The phone was ten dollars cheaper on the windows website. All things considered,  it's a pretty good phone,  just takes some getting used to using coming from an Android phone.

Reviews.Title: The one all important missing feature...
Reviews.Author: xmlsoap
Reviews.Content: Yep, I was raving about this puppy too - especially when you factor in that you don't even have to activate the phone to use its GPS or make free WIFI calls using Skype. Ok, we'll overlook the fact that there is no face viewing camera - but hey, the one it does have is quite wonderful. How easy it is to take snapshots and send them on their way via email.If you do activate the phone, be careful with a 'pay as you go plan' -  that you don't assume that WIFI calls are free. They take their tolls on minutes just like a cellular call.Here is the big disappointment and how I wasted time on this. Even WP support could not tell me where in the cloud the backups are - so there is no way to verify that you have something to restore from until it's pay day.  Most PDA's and all other non windows phones allow you to make a backup image of the phone - just like you would with your laptop or PC.  So imagine spending days getting all your tiles just right and you have apps with data, etc.. and your phone crashes or stops working. No problem, you say. I had the built in Windows app set to do automatic backups. Oh yeah? How far do you think that is going to get you. It's worse than no backup.Layout? gone, App data? that game with 200 save's? gone. Worse - you have to restore over the air using a cellular network because you only get one chance at it - and that is immediately after resetting the phone and before WIFI has been installed. Crazy? Idiotic? Are they still afraid someone is going to clone their software?Oh, it's bad...Kramer would say.

Reviews.Title: Good phone.. except the lack of apps
Reviews.Author: Sumeet Kaul
Reviews.Content: This is a good phone, I like the responsiveness and its sleeky design. But, there are not many apps available...

Reviews.Title: I like it but....
Reviews.Author: inesita
Reviews.Content: I like it but it doesn't support adobe flash player some of the web sites I enjoy need adobe like JustinTV and Ustream  so its a big negative. The sound and the videos from you tube are loud and clear so if they fix that adobe it will make it a great phone but no adobe not so great.

Reviews.Title: needs more apps but its a good phone
Reviews.Author: haskin j
Reviews.Content: the phone needs more apps but the phone works great, need to get a case cause the phone can get slippery at times but its a very small problem

Reviews.Title: A decent smart phone. 3.5 stars
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I was willing to purchase a cheap smart phone just so I may use the internet sparingly for email and for some organization.The phone works well most of the time, the touch screen is nice, the operating system is okay, and the ability to customize home screen is cool (But standard like all smart phones). speed of web browsing is good and battery saver settings are superb and make a full battery last about two or three days with phone calls and texts, and very minimal web browsing.So what are the drawbacks?About once or twice a week, when i click the button on the side of the phone (That turns the display on or off), the phone screen stays black and will not function until you remove the battery and put it back in. After the long load up time, its fine again. Other than that, no real problems..but it is tedious and annoying.Also, the phone camera is only decent (which is expected) but there is no flash feature. The three touch buttons on the front of the phone do not light up, which makes the picture a little misleading.Overall, decent phone if you only plan on using it for calling, texting, and very minimal apps.

Reviews.Title: Getting stuck, no functions at all
Reviews.Author: ARMID GALIJASEVIC
Reviews.Content: from time to time getting stuck, .Have to turn it off to get it back. I wouldn't recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: I like it...but
Reviews.Author: Daniel J. Beard
Reviews.Content: This is my first smart phone and I wanted no contracts and didn't need the all bells and whistles so I took advantage of the low price on the Lumia 521.  For texting, clarity of phone call, 4g connections and wifi this is a really good phone at a good price.The only negatives is the quality of the camera which for 5 megapixel I had hoped would be better.  The other negative is not just for this phone but for windows phones in general and that is the limited number of apps available. Nevertheless for my purposes there is enough.

Reviews.Title: Change your view of a Win 8 phone
Reviews.Author: DRPBL
Reviews.Content: Good buy.Pros: Good performer, decent UI, Nokia quality and apps, great $80 price.Cons: No flash, no rear camera, learning curve steep for android users, limited app storeBought for me mum. I like it for ease of use and integrated design. Not for CyanogenMod lovers.You are limited in what you can do with it. Does allow SD upgrade, Reasonable Nokia music plan and downloadable Nokia maps. Good over all  solution  for the price. At this price no one should be without a smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Its OK
Reviews.Author: cute!
Reviews.Content: okay. So this is the real deal. bought the phone at target and with tmboile 50$ plan. Its OK for it's price. here are the prosPROS:Good for price.Looks and feels good in hand.Phone signal is decent.Volume is ok.Have never drop a call on me.Overall this phone is good. It does what it does. Txting is good. The keypad is good! as good as my 4th gen ipod! The camera is better than my ipod too!Cons.Now what i dont like about this phone is that the BATTERY LIFE SUCKS. Even when its full and im not using it, it loses life really fast. So shutting it down is recommended but turning it back on is a pain in the butt! There's been more than one time when the lumia would just shut donw it self and then it would fail to turn back on no matter how many times i turn it on! Its been a few weeks that this hasn;t happen(ive own it for 3 and a half month).Another things is it is low on apps, which doesnt bother me at all.FB app(for those who likes) is really bad. Scrolling down newsfeed is so annoying! Just flicking the screen sometmes will take you to a fb page that you havent seen before! fiX!

Reviews.Title: Mixed feelings
Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone here a couple weeks ago, and I am using it on the T-Mobile network.UPDATE 1/1/14: I am a couple weeks into using a replacement. Many of my previous comments still hold. A few updates below.On the bright side:- The price is low for all the features of this phone. If it works as advertised, this is a great bargain as an entry level smartphone.- I had not used Windows 8 before, but I found the tiled interface easy to navigate. Tiles for all of the basic functions I want the phone to perform are right there, and I can reorganize them.- The touchscreen is normally very responsive.- Overall, the small size and weight are comfortable for me to hold (although I do use a case for better grip).- Pictures are okay, but I did not have high expectations based on other reviews.  UPDATE 1/1/14: Pictures taken outdoors in good light are actually pretty good. Crisp with accurate color.There are a few things that keep it from being a perfect phone (for me).- I am not a fan of the back cover, that is having to press in on it and pry it off with my nails to access the battery, SIM and memory card. I have imagined breaking the phone in half, however unlikely, or losing grip and flipping this thing across the room which is very, very likely to happen one day. But maybe that's just me.- Signal strength is fine outdoors, but very poor indoors. One or two bars poor. No dropped calls yet, but a lot of breaking up and having to repeat myself. I briefly started looking into signal boosters, but it seems the more effective ones can be up to $300. I was not expecting this additional expense to use a $100 phone. I will check with Nokia and T-Mobile to see if they have other solutions, but poor signal strength is a big deal for me because I want a phone primarily to speak to people and not as much for other tasks and entertainment. I use other devices for that.- But on the other hand...the app store for Windows Phone seems limiting. The selection isn't that large and a lot of it looks like third-party apps I've never heard of and I'm not sure I want to deal with.- For some reason, it keeps losing the WiFi connection even when I've been near the router.  UPDATE 1/1/14: Maintaining the WiFi connection hasn't been a problem with the replacement phone.I may have received a defective one. The touchscreen on my phone became nonresponsive for a while today. I had placed a call that went to the recipient's voicemail, but when I tried to hang up, tapping 'end call,' or the home and back buttons didn't do anything. I hit the power button on the side, and I got the screen that said slide down to power off - hurray for physical buttons - but touching the screen still produced no results. I had to take the battery out. A few reviewers advised not to download too many apps at once. I only downloaded two apps to the phone from sources I thought I could trust.UPDATE 1/1/14: It has only been a couple weeks, but the replacement phone has not frozen up like the first one. I have also downloaded several apps (including the two I downloaded to the first phone) without noticing a change in the overall performance of the phone. The first phone might have had a defect.I'm willing to give it another chance and boost the rating if I don't have another problem like that again.UPDATE 1/1/14: The 3-star rating will stay where it is for now because of different issues. I intended to use this for voice and text, but I tried to use the music + videos app. Unless you are a diehard Windows fan, my advice is to leave that alone. Basic music management tasks are tedious. Navigating the Windows site for help is (still) a chore and revealed a slew of issues users are having with basic functionality of some of the apps. For a tutorial in counterintuitive design, just go to windowsphone.com and search for instructions on "creating a playlist." Read it and weep, people. Download music files from SkyDrive to your Windows Phone? No. If you're not concerned about some apps having a bewildering complexity or limitations, or getting fast help with them, then this phone may be fine for you. I think the Lumia 521 is fine as a basic phone, so that's how I'll have to use it.At least I bought it here and I may still have a chance to exchange it.UPDATE 1/1/14: The replacement process, initiated online, with Amazon was easy and fast. Just returned the first one at UPS and the new one came shortly after. Simple as that. Thanks, Amazon!

Reviews.Author: Tayvon Snowden
Reviews.Content: Oh this phone is a great deal!!!! its an excellent phone for the price. If you havn't tried windows phone like myself this phone is great for starters. Not to be confused with basic features. This phone is excellent. There are a few things I would warn you about though. BUY A CASE!!! I bought a case with mines I would recommend www.amazon.com/dp/B00DUAOZU8/ref=pe_385040_30332190_TE_M3T1_ST1_dp_1 I went to metro pcs before I bought this phone to toy around with their floor model and i noticed it was flat white and the phone itself can be easily scratched up and become filthy quick! That particular case fits great i love it. The phone doesnt have a rotation lock and this can be quite frustrating when your laying down trying to use ure phone unlike my ipad. Overall I LOVE THIS PHONE i was sceptical about getting it because I heard alot of mixed messages but I LOVE IT!!!! IF URE THINKING ABOUT GETTING THIS PHONE GET IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Good smart phone
Reviews.Author: Paul T. Ushijima
Reviews.Content: Less than a week.Upsides (compared to my old smart phone): Only need to recharge less than 1x/day. Really fast. Seems very stable. Very lightweight. Reading format of email is very easy to read and very attractive. Better keyboard layout than Android 2.1. Camera resolution is fine for me, I remember when getting digital cameras at this resolution was an expensive proposition and higher resolution means bigger files anyway.Downsides: Limited availability of apps (compared to Android). Sync (or lack thereof) with Google Contacts is a problem for me. It is unclear why certain contacts will sync and others will not. Email and Calendar syncing works fine.

Reviews.Title: Quick but Quirky
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: Pros: Cheap and fast. You will not find an Android phone in this price range that has such a smooth and lag-free experience. The maps are OK, and the store isn't bad at all either.Cons: Battery critically low will constantly alert you even if there is ten hours left. No way to disable it. The maps do not let you see the directions ahead of time, and it has limited customization options. Camera is terrible.The Bottom line: I can take the cons because the phone is quick and responsive when I need it to be.

Reviews.Title: Serves Its Purpose
Reviews.Author: Sankha Lakshan Wanigasekara
Reviews.Content: The phone is good for serving all your basic functions of messaging and taking phone calls, but it's sometimes too slow when opening apps like Facebook. That may be a problem with the third party application, but apps tend to crash or freeze sometimes. The only issues would be limited apps in the Nokia/Windows store and the slow speed of some apps.

Reviews.Title: the box was a little crushed
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle Vaz
Reviews.Content: Box wasn't in top condition but the product was. Pleasantly surprised. I really enjoyed the fast shipping via Prime and that the product was as described.

Reviews.Title: Poor product quality and poor customer service.
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: The charger for the device broke after only five weeks.  I contacted Nokia customer service.  They wanted me to send the charger back to Texas for evaluation.  The problem is this type of device needs to be charged almost daily.  I asked Nokia to send me a replacement charger so that I can use while they work on the old one. I was told this type of charger was out of stock and they had to fix the old one and then give it back to me.  I was told that they did not have any local service stores for the charger and the only service center was in Texas.  I bought the device from Nokia store at Amazon.com and offered to provide the order number.  I was told Nokia does not use that information and I need to provide other form of proof of purchase.  I was told to provide detailed information about the purchase and myself and package the charger properly before sending to protect it from damage.  Considering the charger is properly worth no more than a few dollars, the time, money and effort to fix the charger is just too much.  Nokia is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Quit working, no return to Amazon
Reviews.Author: John W. Barton
Reviews.Content: I had this unit for about two months when it quit working.  I tried to return it to Amazon but they said I had missed the return date and would not take it back, so much for Amazon's return policy.  Other then that I called the service provider and was told that there were a lot of complaints about this phone and that they would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: 2nd replacement still not working
Reviews.Author: Makana
Reviews.Content: Phone keeps shutting off, even after battery is fully charged.  This is my 2nd phone.  I had to return the 1st one due to camera button not working!!!!  I ordered 2 of these phones and so far the other phone is working just fine.  Bad Luck???? Not sure if i should have it repaired or just look into another brand.  Frustrated.........

Reviews.Title: good for talking/texting ... not a lot more
Reviews.Author: cerealus
Reviews.Content: I started with an iPhone 3 ... had that almost 3yr ... then I went to android Galaxy (a nice one) ... then a cheaper Galaxy ("exhibit" ... no-contract)Just a few weeks ago, I bought my first Windows 8 device ... an 8in tablet ... with 8.1 on it ... despite the lack of anything resembling a Swype-style keyboard, I was very, very impressed with itI didn't expect a Windows phone to be like my new tablet ... but I also couldn't imagine it'd be so far off ... and it didn't have to be!First and foremost, unlike (possibly) many other iPhone or android phone owners, I don't (actually) use my phone for much ... other than making phone calls ... and the occasional text ... even then, it's not much ... it's very much a matter of convenience for me to have one ... and I could probably easily go w/o, entirelyI like android ... there's things I don't like ... but IMO, apple and Windows (at least their phone OS) don't even come close to what android offers (flame away!)By all rights, I should've bought an S3 or S4 mini ... that would very much be the phone I'd prefer ... and, now that I say it, for another $150, that probly woulda been smart money ... but, I really like getting deals ... and $80 for a Nokia "smart" phone seemed too good to pass up ... particularly for what I actually use a phone for (my tablets are another story, entirely)That said, MS saw fit to provide absolutely NO way to look at the files ... either on your phone ... or on your microsd card ... NONE! ... best ya can do is find an app by someone (no, not MS ... not apple ... not google ... no one like that), install it, and cross your fingers ... which I did ... it would not display basically any file I had on my microsd because they do not end with a "y" ... SERIOUSLY! ... check it out!Also, and this is the #1 problem with my tablet, as well ... the onscreen keyboard is pick-n-poke ONLY ... no Swyping (swyper)!  If you're not used to using Swype on android, this is probly no big deal to you ... but once you're used to Swyping, taking it away is very, very unsettling ... again, I don't use my phone for much ... for texting, no Swyping is a pain ... but I'm not writing novels, eitherI'm not gonna whine about the lack of apps ... there's actually a fair number of apps ... and most of em look to suck pretty hard ... but if anyone thinks the vast majority of android apps don't suck, they're off their rocker!  That said, I'm not seeing a GMail app by Google ... a few by what's-his-name ... ya, I'm gonna give you my gmail credentials!It did come with Office ... that's pretty neat ... so, I go to open a tab-delimited file I got on my skydrive (same account) ... right in Excel, they got a menu that says "skydrive" ... I tap it ... it opens IE!!!! ... REALLY?!!! ... so eventually I install the skydrive app (why it didn't come with the phone, I can't imagine ... particularly considering the bloatware they otherwise got on there) ... anyhow, even the skydrive app knows nothing of Excel ... and aside from its existence, Excel knows nothing of skydrive ... and of course, there's no way, in Excel, to navigate any files, to open a tab-delimited file.  I imagine, if ya otherwise got an .xls on there, it's like photos, songs, or videos ... there's probly a scanner that keeps track of what's on there, and tells the appEvery once in a while, we'd joke with a younger guy about to get married ... tell him horror stories, and how he's gonna regret it.  Excel is very much like this.  If you're married to it, things may be ok ... but if ya ever want a divorce, LOOK OUT!I had Polaris Office on my Galaxy ... that was excellent! ... even then, I had to download a Google spreadsheet at work, so I could open it with Excel, to save it as an earlier version, that Polaris could open ... and then I learned, only Samsung devices can run Polaris! ... everything else is garbage!It's amazing to me, in 2013 ... some 30yr after Lotus-1-2-3, I can't pass around a spreadsheet w/o running into either someone doesn't have software to open it ... or their software just can't open my version of it ... and/or they otherwise gotta be using a particular brand of hardware ... or otherwise pay $100+/yr ... just for the privilege of keeping data in rows and columns!... but I digress ... I didn't take the star off cause of the fact that everyone wants to get paid, one way or the other, for using spreadsheets ... I took the star off cause Excel on this phone has no clue what's going on with my skydrive ... and unlike my tablet, even though the set-up asked me if I wanted to, my phone has no clue about my skydrive ... or at least, if it does, I have no way to find the files on my phone, that're otherwise also on my skydrive ... I honestly can't imagine no one lost their job over this!otherwise, like switching between apple and android, Windows phones have their own idiosyncrasies ... in the case of windows, you need to navigate from the "start" to get to "settings", than work your way down, to find things like "bluetooth" and "running apps" ... not the least of which, "blocking background tasks" and "battery-saver option" ... vs. merely swiping from the top, or one corner, on android ... and tapping :"bluetooth", and the likespeaking of the battery, I'm hoping it's good enough to last a full day ... on stand-by! ... but if you like to use your phone for much more than talking/texting (or a lot of that) throughout the day, you should probably carry a cord with ya!now for the really bad news ... so, there's three "buttons" along the bottom ... "<--" (back), (home), and (search) ... guess what (search) does?! ... it opens BING!!!! .... even when ya don't mean to brush your thumb against that area of the screen, it opens BING!!!At the end of the day, it's a Nokia ... and despite the shortcomings, the Windows OS on it appears to drive phone calling and texting just fine ... despite attempting to get ya to open an "XBox account" every time, even the music app ain't too bad ... it also comes with a built-in FM radio (uses the headphones wire as an antenna) ... and it works quite well!As a phone, for the price they're going for now, to spend any less on a Sparq er whatever is absolutely insane!This is a "good" phone! ... it's no S3 er S4 ... but it's still a "good" phone!

Reviews.Title: The Downsides to This Phone
Reviews.Author: Stilt Wiltafacation
Reviews.Content: I've given it a good rating because the price is amazing. But even at this price I can't keep it because:IE browser refreshes almost any time you revisit the page or tab. This is an obvious collaboration between the phone companies and Microsoft to force the user to waste bandwidth and to pay more for their data. No settings, and no other free browser apps in the store. IE mobile didn't use to do this, they spent money on this new "feature".The calendar reminder sound is totally lame. I can't count on it to remind me of anything. My HD2 was/is great about this.It's easy to miss texts.Doing pretty much anything takes at least 3 taps. My HD2 does most things with one tap.I'm going back to my HD2.Edit --I'm loving my old HD2.I think I've figured out why I don't like Windows Phone 8. They made the OS into an app. By doing so they removed a ton of functionality. That sucks. Won't be buying a Win 8 phone again.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, if you get a good one.
Reviews.Author: T. Craw
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these phones from Amazon recently, and here's my take on the phone.The phone itself is fantastic.  It's just the right size. Not so big that you have to hold it with both hands, and not so small that you feel cheated. The look and feel of W8 on this device is amazing.  It's such a smooth platform. And I think it's really user friendly. The only thing I didn't care for is that they don't have all the apps I use, yet, and that I have to set up a Microsoft account to download apps. Both just bothersome, not deal breakers. Sadly one of the two phones I bought is going back.  It repeatedly turns itself off for no apparent reason.  It can happen in middle of a call or when it's just sitting around. 90% of the time when it comes back on it's in airplane mode.  So I go to the settings to turn that mode off, and it won't let me. SO, I have to take my protective case off (a PINB by the way), take the back of the phone off, and pull the battery out and reinsert for it to come back on in the correct mode. The other phone, which is my husband's, hasn't had this problem, so I'm hoping it was an isolated incident. I don't want to take any chances though, so I opted for the full refund and will wait for the Nexus 5 to hit. Basically, get this phone because it's a great deal for this price, but make sure yours isn't a dud before your return window is closed.On another note, totally unrelated to the 3 star review of this product, is the terrible service I received from Amazon on this item.  I've never had shipping problems with them before, but they really dropped the ball on this one. It took them a whole 6 days after I ordered to even ship the item. Once it was shipped it sat at the carriers facility for another 2 days before they sent it on it's way.  Total fail! I would have understood if the item was back ordered, but they were showing in stock the whole time.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Phone and Company
Reviews.Author: Shawn "picky mom"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my daughter for Christmas.  Had it 6 months and it started turning itself off all the time.  Then it wouldn't charge.  Showed the charging icon but battery wouldn't charge.  I sent it in for repair and they returned it saying the wouldn't fix it under warranty because it "showed damage that isn't covered under Nokia limited warranty."  The form letter didn't explain what the damage was or what was covered under warranty.  I will never buy another Nokia product again.

Reviews.Title: A lousy software design and mediocre hardware.
Reviews.Author: Frank Yang
Reviews.Content: A lousy software design and mediocre hardware.  But considering the low price, I can not complain too much.  I bought it only for temporary (about 4-5 months) while I am waiting for iPhone release.

Reviews.Title: Wish it had a front camera!
Reviews.Author: Robert M. B.
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because it's a smart phone with a prepaid option. A two year contract wasn't what I was looking for but I also didn't want a crappy phone. The Nokia Lumia is right in the sweet spot with monthly plans and smart phone features! My biggest issue with the Lumia is the lack of a front screen camera. I love Skype and use it frequently , but without the front screen camera that's pretty much impossible. Generally speaking I like to be loyal to MS but because the Lumia doesn't have a front cam, I'll still be using my iPod touch on a daily basis. Wish I could just use one product! a windows phone not an Iphone. Besides that it seems like a great deal for the money and I'm quite loving the experience. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Demicha Harrison
Reviews.Content: at first the phone was highly recommended for others to buy, not so much anymore. bought the phone in the beginning of December, it is now the middle of april and my phone ABSOLUTELY DOES NOT WORK. out of no where. at first it would turn on and off by itself without me being able to make a simple phone call. now the phone wont turn on at all but it shows that the battery is charging. and just my luck I cant return it because its past jan 31st. hopefully this will prevent someone from making the same mistake I did

Reviews.Title: The weakest link = Windows 8
Reviews.Author: da perfesser
Reviews.Content: The hardware's not bad. Once I got a good case for it the problems with it leaping from my pocket were fixed. Whoever heard of a white phone?? Impossible to keep this thing clean. Every time I had to open it up to access the MicroSD card, I felt like I was going to snap it in half. Practically impossible to pry it open without losing a fingernail or two, and I'm not talking about custom manicured dainty nails, either! I could have lived with all that, though.You can sure tell it's a Windows phone. It reboots spontaneously without provocation. When I open an app, it'll reboot. When I just want to get to the home screen, it'll reboot. It's even rebooted when I tried to answer an incoming call! Oh, not always. Not even most of the time. But often enough that I know it has Microsoft inside. I can't recommend this on its strengths, and its weaknesses are too many. I just ordered a Motorola Razr i to replace it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price, but slow
Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: Super slow, everything I've done takes a couple minutes. And a few times, the touch screen has become unresponsive. I click the power button to go to the lock screen again, and it works, but the fact that the touch screen sometimes doesn't register my fingers is kind of iffy. I've only just got it, so I'll update this when I've used it more.

Reviews.Title: Calls drop sporadically
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: Overall a good phone for the price.The one issue I have is with the "dailer" app. Keeps on hanging up during calls. I've tried with turning off the screen while on the call - the same issue. Putting the phone on speaker reduces the frequency of this bug, but I cannot be on speaker constantly just because this device/software glitches. This negates all the positives of this device and I will be replacing it.

Reviews.Title: Faulty Product
Reviews.Author: Isaiah
Reviews.Content: The phone itself isnt too bad but it started to reboot constantly a week after the return policy was up. Due to the snow storms in my area I haven't been outside so I know it didn't drop or get water damage. When i finally got a chance to take it to someone thinking it was the battery they informed me that it was the phone itself and that I should return it which of course I'm unable to.

Reviews.Title: It's broken after I used for 6 months
Reviews.Author: Rock4Sea
Reviews.Content: Be careful when you purchase this product. There is no warranty for this item. My phone broken after used for 6 months

Reviews.Title: buyer beware
Reviews.Author: teach
Reviews.Content: this phone stopped working one week after it could not be returned they don't even offer an exchange this is the second item that was electronic I bought from amazon for Christmas that stopped working within days of the no return. I would have been happy even if they offered to fix the phone so be ware some are good and if you get one that is not good too bad.

Reviews.Title: Turns on and off by itslef
Reviews.Author: Stacey Parenti
Reviews.Content: All though it has very good features, It turns itself on and off without even being touched. Would not recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: watch the buttons on the side
Reviews.Author: kathleen sch
Reviews.Content: It quit ringing, and I took it to a T-Mobile store and I was told, to fix the speaker, "you have to send it to Finland."  And I don't think there is any warranty after 30 days.  I was rather angry.  Added later - the phone guy didn't know this phone.  Today I talked to someone at T-Mobile who was knowledgeable and he showed me how to get it to ring again. The problem is the buttons on the side of the phone are right there where I grab it, and I had accidently lowered the ring volume to zero.

Reviews.Title: Good phone if you just talk and text
Reviews.Author: Valeriya Zelenyak
Reviews.Content: If all you need in a phone is talk and text, this phone is perfect for you. On this phone, my internet was slower and my facebook feed was inconsistent with the feed on my computer. There is no facetime camera, nor is there flash therefore there is no flashlight. The app store is horrible. The version for yahoo mail and gmail is has an inconvenient interface. If you want to play up-to-date games, forget about it. I could only get the first version of temple run (which is about 3 years old), and a few other games that aren't too interesting or developed. A smartphone should be great features that do cool things but the program was extremely simple. Also the keyboard was not very comfortable. Again, if you are not tech savvy this phone is perfect for you. If you are a person who constantly needs to keep in touch for work and school on email and update documents on drive, save up and buy a better phone.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Jay J Roth
Reviews.Content: My son loves itI don't hold Nokia responsible for the fact that I don't like the windows 8 OS so I give it a high rating as a great value

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia $20 Voucher Useless
Reviews.Author: R Tan
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of the Nokia Lumia 521 for myself and my son and thought had a great deal due to the additional $20 Nokia Lumia voucher promo.  We received the voucher codes sent to us by Nokia and neither one works.  Both says that the codes have been redeemed already when we just got the emails from Nokia. Complained to Nokia Customer Support and a week later still have not received any action.I have to say though that the Lumia 521 itself works pretty well with the battery staying a good full 24 hours with normal use.

Reviews.Title: HeeeeeeYYYYY !!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ralph Gandy
Reviews.Content: good quality phone, great price !!!!!BAda GADA bada GadDa OOPp DADA PoP DOLLA MoLLA BEE BOOPMeow KiTtY WOO WOO

Reviews.Title: Nokia 521
Reviews.Author: Yvette
Reviews.Content: I don't like the way the phone calls are set up, I am use to missed, placed, dial, etc.  They are all in one section no separation.

Reviews.Title: If only it received a signal.
Reviews.Author: Alberto Martinez
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone, if only I was able to receive a signal. My old Android phone always had a full signal, but this guy receives no signal at all. It only does it while I'm at work. It gets a strong signal everywhere else. But I spend nine hours at work. If I can't get a signal for nine consecutive hours this really is not a good phone for me. What makes it weird is that I haven't changed providers, only phones. Why would that make a difference? It's a bummer, too. Because it is an awesome phone otherwise. Great features, easy to use...

Reviews.Title: The real thing
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother and I currently have the phone so I know the ins and outs of the phone already

Reviews.Title: Phone worth of its prize
Reviews.Author: Dr Preetida J Bhetariya "Preetida J"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for smartphone with all the basic necessities of a phone. And here it is, after using iPhone and Samsung galaxy, it surely a compromise, but with this prize, it's awesome deal. However it does not support google map or gmail applications, but you can use that through web. Application store for Nokia is the reason this phone never gain popularity, as the store have very limited apps. And it's hard to find option too. Overall I will rate is a smart and economical purchase.

Reviews.Title: i love this phone
Reviews.Author: chocolatathunder
Reviews.Content: only thing is that it was locked  and im sure i ordered it unlocked  and there was no ear phone with it other wise it is a wonderful phone to buy

Reviews.Title: Great phone - with limitations
Reviews.Author: Cori M. Endrizzi
Reviews.Content: Ok so this is coming from an android user for the last 3/4 years... I decided to give windows 8 and nokia a chance.This review will be about both the Windows Phone OS and the phone itself.  There are pros and cons to each.Pros:It just works. Easy to get email and texts and everything working.Stable without crashes.Office apps are awesome.Camera and video look great in daylightLove the tiles and the layout - very customizable and functionalGreat battery life.  One thing I noticed is that the battery doesnt drain as much as my android phone when idle.  If I leave the phone overnight for 8 hours it will drain about 10% while on all night.  I can often go 2 days on one charge if I haven't been streaming videos, etc.Beautiful ScreenSnappy and responsiveCons:Wifi calling doesnt allow MMS... this really sucks.. you get a message and cant open it.Apps are limited.  I didn't think this would be that big of a deal - but I realized that a lot of the social things on my phone I now cannot do.  Whenever my friends say "hey download this app" everyone on android and iOS can get it... usually its not an option so I miss out.No facebook, instagram, and other major apps.  This deserves a completely different point.  Really microsoft its 2013!?I miss Swype, Chrome, etc.  Defaults in wOS are good but having options is better.No LED flash for the camera.No front facing camera.The phone without a case is slippery.  I almost dropped it.  A friend was looking at it and almost dropped it.  Get a caseFinal thoughts - I feel like the OS is awesome.  I like the tiles and the design.  The apps they have seem to work really well - the ones that you can get...  But, there is just so much missing....it just feels incomplete.  If you use your cellphone for texting, calling, web browsing and creating documents this is a great phone.  If your phone is your constant social connection with the outside world, windows phone OS leaves you sitting indoors on a sunny day looking out a window at all the kids in the neighborhood playing - wishing you could join in.Phone - great value.  for the cost you get an amazing piece of hardware.  Not the best on the market - but a great value! 4.5/5 starsOS - what it does have is great.  Design is great.  Just needs more.  A lot more.  3.5/5 stars

Reviews.Title: Great phone, Worst operating system! You'll feel the Windows OS quality downgrade
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: I don't know why Nokia dropped the Meemo/Meego/Hartman/Symbian operating systems, which were the BEST, simple and most effective. The Windows Mobile 8 operating system makes the Nokia phone just not "SMART" enough for a smartphone. Just like the Windows 8 that I choose to ditch in the favor of Windows Pro 7, the windows mobile 8 is probably by far the worst compared to iOS, Android and other proprietary OS's.Don't get me wrong: the phone is good, light weight, looks solid, decent appearance, good battery life indeed. Highly excited about the new phone, as I stick my sim card in, I can't see my contacts. You require a MICROSOFT account to ACCESS all your CONTACTS, leaving your privacy completely exposed. If you do create a Microsoft account, all of the sudden, ALL YOUR CONTACTS are uploaded on the Microsoft server, along with your history. Why can't I just use the phone WITHOUT giving Microsoft my list of contacts? Why does Microsoft need to know and access that? I tried deleting the contacts, and guess what? Just like the GMAIL account ( that I dropped years ago for privacy reasons) Microsoft will still "keep" all your contacts "just in case you change your mind"! And it tracks ALL your history of browsing, calling, texting, searching and installed apps! I feel like the Big Brother watching over my shoulder! I call that INVASION OF PRIVACY! I can't sync my private email account, unless it's an "APPROVED VENDOR" on the list, that likes to create and keep a history of everything you do on the account. I can't fully use the bluetooth features like with other phones (Iphone and Android). I can't just close an application when I have multiple apps opened, instead you have to select it and keep clicking on back until it takes you to the main Home Screen.Update:Major Cons:1) I found most of the apps to be useless/"entry level". Can't compare the quality of the apps to the iOS and Android. ( I had both) If you are a heavy user of email / productivity apps you'll hardly find anything on the "Microsoft Market". You'll be able to open Microsoft Office docs but you'll need an app for PDF's, that will be "entry level". Android opens PDF's "natively" and even has a "night mode" to invert colors! What a downgrade!2) You cannot sync all your accounts in one along with receiving updates as they come in. The phone will only sync the mail box/ other apps "every 15, 30 minutes / 1 or 2 hrs".2) Camera only works in good day light with a "decent" resolution and quality and there's no flash. Don't expect anything else from the camera.3) The phone side buttons and touch "buttons" are not clearly marked / lit. If you're in the dark it will take a while to figure out where to press.4) Screen although responsive when sliding, it lags and does not fully react to smaller option menus or when trying to accurately copy/paste. Cheap phone, cheap response.5) Closing an app will take longer than with any other OS. Basically you click and hold back, wait for the opened app screen, selected the app and just press escape(back until closed. (this could be as long as 9 to 12 times if you've clicked several options in the app, tracking your steps backwards) Really?6) Auto rotation of the screen cannot be removed/stopped. This can get annoying if you're not sitting/standing in vertical position.7) Bluetooth will only work for certain devices / services.Major Pros1) Nokia off-line GPS and maps are the ONLY good thing, (that's not Microsoft's credit) worth with this phone.2) Relatively cheap phone.Inconclusivea)Battery is good, not great. You can charge it every day or 1-1/2 days but no more than that.b) The so-called wifi calling only gives you the option of making calls over your wifi but does not increase the quality of the call. Unless you are within the clear range (same room with the router, no walls) of the wifi transmitter, EXPECT the call to DROP!c) You don't get any cool pre-installed ring tones, but at least the speaker and the audio volume will be loud.
