This should be expected from a phone.Overall in my experience Windows Mobile just sucks (Not just version 8)! This is a major flaw that cannot be corrected no matter what windows phone you'll get. I'm sorry but I'll have to take this back and stick to another operating system.

Reviews.Title: Battery doesn't fit properly, otherwise a great phone.
Reviews.Author: Pmm368
Reviews.Content: After some debate if I should get this phone (since it's a Windows phone), I purchased this phone on the 24th October, 2013 at a local Wal-Mart for $100.  For the first 3 days I had this running, it worked great.  Over the last 4 days, this phone has been restarting itself several times (usually 3 to 7 times) a day.  Turns out the battery doesn't fit in the phone properly (little bit of wiggle room, causes the battery to come loose from the battery terminals on the phone).Pros:5MP camera.The pictures come out better than I thought, sometimes the photo comes out blurry but the majority of the time it takes pictures really well.  Shoots video in 720P High Definition at 10mbps.4G HSPA+Not LTE, but decent.  The coverage is great in my area and I get anywhere between 4 & 8 mbps download speeds.  The ping is usually between 80 & 100 MS.Mobile Hotspot.This phone allows you to tether your internet connection, depending on your plan.GPSBest GPS I've used on a phone.  The GPS I've used on any of my previous Android phones would give me turn-by-turn directions, but Windows is the only one I've used that tells me the speed limit in an area.  I can also use it to tell me how fast I'm travelling and how far I've traveled.  I had to install a separate app on Android to do that.Cons:Music.  Transferring music to the phone seems to be a pain in the rear.  I transferred music using Windows Media Player, but after I deleted a folder, none of my music showed up in my phone again.Battery.  As stated above, battery is fairly loose from the battery terminal on the phone, causing it to restart on me several times in a day.  It usually happens when it's in my pocket while I'm walking.Transferring files off the phone via online storage.  I installed dropbox, hoping to be able to upload photos to my dropbox, but I can only put it on my skydrive.  Videos can only be uploaded over WiFi to prevent going over your data package.Transferring files via bluetooth.  I have sent files from this phone to an Android tablet and it works good.  I can only transfer pictures via bluetooth, but not videos.Overall, I would've given this phone a 4 star if it hadn't been for the battery problem I'm facing.  I'll update if the company (either Nokia or T-Mobile) is able to fix this problem.Edit 11/1/13My phone has shut itself off 14 times from 10pm 10/31/13 to 7:30am 11/1/13.  I'm not taking a chance on trying another Lumia phone.  I was hoping for a more reliable phone for $100.Edit 11/3/13I returned the phone back to the store to get my money back.  Unfortunately, Wal-mart wouldn't let me keep the sim card, which contained my phone number that I wanted to keep.  I started a number port to my home phone, so I'm hoping Wal-mart keeps it active long enough for the transfer to go through.  Oh well, this is what I get for going 10 years of not having a Nokia phone (haven't heard about Nokia until the Lumia line-up)

Reviews.Title: Good, after use I give it 4 stars instead of 3.
Reviews.Author: M. Bryant "SilverbackvsGrizzly"
Reviews.Content: I am coming from a samsung exhibit II, and basically I should have stayed with the samsung.Pros of the Nokia:- Nice screen, clear sharp images- snappy responsive UI- The windows interface is a nice change from the android one, it feels more exciting. Live tiles is a nice concept.- Camera takes good pictures as long as there is light.-There are some good decent apps.-texting is nice. I thought I would miss android swype, but I don't.-Web browser works better on the sites that it does work on.Cons:-No flash on rear camera.-No front camera (i.e no face time/skype type video chat)-Browser not compatible with some sites that my android was.(overall the browser is better though on the windows phone, see edit)-Many apps that i use (i.e chase mobile banking) do not work or are bugged. You can tell that developers still don't give windows phone the same amount of care that android or apple get. Not nokia's or windows fault, but still a con for the consumer.EDIT: So, I was comparing this to the exhibit II, and it is better than the exhibit II, IF you don't really care about a no front facing camera.The reason I have given this phone 4 stars from an original 3 is because after some use, this phone is much better at web browsing. This is important for me. The datasense server from Microsoft preloads webpages then delivers to your phone. This is huge. With my exhibit II, I would have to download videos and they would take forever. now, with this phone, the same videos are instant (almost). This added one star to the my original rating.And, after messing with the settings, I got the battery life to match my exhibit two..

Reviews.Title: Phone is nice - did not come with screen protector or car charger
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: Phone is nice - did not come with screen protector or car charger as indicated.The images for the phone clearly show a screen protector and car charger. Based on those items I thought the slight increase over T-Mobile price was worth it. The unit is new and is a nice phone, but missing the car charger and protector reduces the value of the purchase.-Light - but not flimsy-Speaker is okay, sounds surprisingly good for a phone-Screen is sharp-Windows 8 is really good (shocking) so far-Camera is okay, but sluggish

Reviews.Title: The worst customer service -- the phone stopped working; replacement battery not shipped because it is out of stock
Reviews.Author: David Feldman
Reviews.Content: The phone was purchased in June 2013.  In six months it was not taking a charge properly.  I assumed that my teenaged daughter was not being vigilant about properly recharging the phone.  It turns out there is a problem with the phone.I went to T-Mobile in February and they took $20 from me and arranged to have a new phone sent to me.  On receipt of the new phone, I was to switch out the battery, memory card, SIM and the back of the phone, returning the non-working phone to T-Mobile.  I did this.  Problem solved?  No, the battery still did not hold a charge.Soon after, I went to T-Mobile and was told to call Nokia customer care, which would send me a new battery free of charge.  I called Nokia, spent a few minutes on the phone, and was told a battery would be sent to me.  Then I waited.  We went on vacation out of the country.  We returned.  Still, no battery.April 11, 2014 I called Nokia customer care.  They have no record of my previous conversation, but promise to send me a new battery, which should reach me in a week of less.  This time I get a tracking number.  I wait a week -- no battery.  I wait longer -- no battery.April 22, 2014, around 11 a.m. EST,  I called Nokia customer care to ask about the battery.  I was told that the battery was not in stock.  The battery is made in Finland, but needs to be sent to Asia before it can be shipped to the U.S. and they just don't have the battery.  On April 11, 2014 the customer service representative checked to make sure the battery was in stock.  They could not tell me when the battery would be in stock.  Can I get a refund?  No.  What can I do?  The customer service representative said he the problem would be escalated and I would be contacted later in the day.Despite being told I would be contacted again, I was not contacted.April 28, 2014, today, I called Nokia customer care.  Yes, they have a record of the prior conversations.  No, the battery has not come back in stock.  No, they do not know when they will have the battery, but they will ship it to me when they get it.  Can they give me an idea of how long that might be?  No.  I asked if anyone tried to reach me by email or phone after the problem was escalated (which is what I was told would happen) and was told that they do not have any record of anyone at Nokia attempting to reach me by email or phone.If you buy a Nokia phone, don't expect any assistance from Nokia if you have a problem with the phone.

Reviews.Title: Not sure what all the hype is for....
Reviews.Author: shmitty01 "shmitty01"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone 7 months ago as a primary phone for my wife.  At first, I was impressed with the features vs price.  It quickly became evident why this phone is so cheap.  The problems started showing up quickly, and only got worse with time.  As t mobile has poor coverage at our home, wifi calling was crucial for this phone to work.  First, windows phone OS is not capable of MMS over wifi calling.  This may not matter to some people, but we like to exchange pictures with friends and relatives, and this is not possible over wifi calling with this phone.  Issue 2, also related to wifi calling.  Frequent dropped calls, poor call quality, etc.  Sometimes the calls were great, sometimes very bad.  As time continued, another problem with wifi calling came up.  When you would leave the house and return, the phone would refuse to reconnect to wifi calling(while connected to the network fine) and would show no signal.  The phone required a hard reset to resolve the issue.  As for the good, the camera is ....ok.  The phone is fairly durable.  Battery life is great.  I have always had a great love for nokia phones because of their call quality and durability.  This phone has lost me for nokia permanently.  Maybe the problems are all related to windows 8, I am not certain.  We have since upgraded to a Samsung Galaxy Light, and guess what?  It works!  And it works really well at that.  Not sure why we stuck with this dud for so long.  Maybe if you have excellent t mobile coverage and no need for wifi calling, this phone could work for you as a budget entry level smart phone.  As for me, I think this will be my last nokia.

Reviews.Title: I regret it
Reviews.Author: joel
Reviews.Content: The phone doesn't turn on anymore after two weeks. When you turn it on it just go blank I will call amazon and get my money back

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS for the Wi-Fi calling ability!
Reviews.Author: M. Hutchins
Reviews.Content: Let me state that I primarily use this phone with the Wi-Fi calling feature, as I do not have cell service at home.  This is the main reason I got this phone (the low price, plus ability to do Wi-Fi calling).  It took some talking to customer service to get it working correctly, but once they got it fixed, it worked well for about a month or two.  Then I was getting an increasing number of days with Wi-Fi calling glitches.  T-Mobile replaced it with another phone, same model.  It is starting to get glitch as well.  I'm not convinced they have the bugs out of the software and I am constantly (CONSTANTLY) having to fiddle with it if I want it to work.  My new replacement phone is sitting on the kitchen table, turned off, as I write this.  I have no phone now.The one thing I can say is that T-Mobile has THE BEST customer service I have ever experienced.  They are hands-down my favorite carrier, even though their coverage area is smaller than say, Verizon, because they are very willing to help you out.  However, if you are considering buying this phone and you plan to use Wi-Fi calling on a regular basis, look elsewhere.  Maybe an Android phone.  Not this one. My husband's phone is acting up as well.  Both of ours have had problems working correctly on the cellular network as well.  Just don't buy this phone.

Reviews.Title: Horrible phone
Reviews.Author: Sheri farias
Reviews.Content: This phone was great at first. But now it shuts off all the time and doesn't hold a charge. I just bought this phone 2 months ago. I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Price is great, but that's about it
Reviews.Author: Raye
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive replacement for my Android smartphone that died. Unfortunately, this one sucks. For starters, it's a Windows phone, which should have been a red flag! Lousy apps, including even the most basic stuff like driving directions. Limited functionality - doesn't even seem to have the handy "swipe" feature for writing emails and texts. Games are pale imitations of the good stuff. Oh, and no flash for the camera - plus it's super-clunky to operate. No complaints about T-Mobile, though!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone - Lots of cool features, but touch screen froze fatally after less than a month
Reviews.Author: Sheila Szczepaniak
Reviews.Content: There is so much to like about this phone.  It is intuitive, fast response/processor time.  Can't really beat the features for this price point.  Having access to the MS Office tools on a phone is also a great thing.The con many folks will note is the limited app availability.  It's also befuddling that you need to buy a .99 cent app to use your Starbucks card, when Android and iPhone have it for free.The other major drag was that the screen froze up just shy of the 30 day mark.  To be fair, T-Mobile shipped a warranty replacement which would take 3 business days, which was a MAJOR problem since I was leaving the country the next day.  I was not confident in this product to have them sell me a new unit of the same phone, so I had to go with a Samsung.I really like the Windows interface and Nokia really seems to be thundering back with cool products with amazing cameras built in, but I'm afraid this experience is forcing me to sit out of the Nokia field for a while.

Reviews.Title: no windows phone! !
Reviews.Author: Brandy B.
Reviews.Content: Not a windows phone fan! !! Cannot do stuff like an android does! Stick with android if you are a big music downloader and YouTube watcher

Reviews.Title: Overall ,good phone. Camera is too bad.
Reviews.Author: Shriram
Reviews.Content: Its is good and cheapest smartphone. But camera is a major drawback. If you compare 5 MP from apple and 5 MP from nokia, you will see the difference. Nokia needs to improve a lot.

Reviews.Title: no quality
Reviews.Author: Judi Schoon
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these. The reviews said they were of good quality , they are very slow and not of quality.

Reviews.Title: dont waste your money
Reviews.Author: Roy
Reviews.Content: This phone is horrible. Dont reward them for the poor design and functionality. The phone shuts off randomly at least 3 times per week. Several reviewers have noted this same phenomenon. Search for it on google and you will see the same.Also transferring images (which the camera is like seeing an 80s home video) from your phone to your computer is a disaster. You would think you would be able to select all the images at once, or at least click the top one, hold shift, and select the bottom one. But thats not possible. You have to manually choose every picture you need to transfer from your phone. They added a sync button but only from the PC to the phone, not the other way around.The app store is a joke compared to android and iphone. You can only setup 1 custom screen, then the next screen is a full list of all your applications in alphabetical order, so you cant re-arrange them or create multiple screens like you can for android. I cant get over how crappy this phone is, and dont understand how this can get so many positive reviews. I am totally and completely unsatisfied. I wont even give it to my teenager, Id rather trash it.

Reviews.Title: Good Applications , Poor Reception
Reviews.Author: Lucero
Reviews.Content: I was excited to use the phone because it has Windows 8 system It is very easy to use and after a few minutes, you are able to use the phone for all your needs. Unfortunately, It has bad reception (unless it has to do with T-Mobile) and when on speaker there is a lot of interruption. The people on the other end of the conversation can't understand what I'm saying. I have to hang up and re-call them.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumina
Reviews.Author: Kimberly R.
Reviews.Content: The phone does its job, not as much features as an android phone. I would recommend this phone to someone that wants a easy phone to operate and understand

Reviews.Title: better than expected
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: It is a down grade if you are coming from using an iPhone or galaxy  but it's not a bad phone.I like it because it connects to my window 8 computers so any files on my computerI can get it on my phone too! Plus I'm able to open up word document  and type.The only thing I hate about this phone is that there's no front camera and I can't screen shotBut its not a bad phone for the cost.

Reviews.Title: Good device however painful activation with T-Mobile
Reviews.Author: Yeoman "Yeoman"
Reviews.Content: Device itself is great and works as it supposed to be however activating with T-Mobile was pain. Not sure if it is the source of the device or T-Mobile activation/support team [out of Texas]. I was given third degree as this phone/device was stolen equipment. Finally after a week and multiple calls to T-Mobile, now it has service.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT "BUDGET FRIENDLY" ALTERNATIVE TO iPhone, Android .... BUT HAS SHORTCOMINGS
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Other reviews pretty accurate:Pros:  PRICE - considering UNLOCKED and can go without a contract (pay by the minute, and I only access data over my wi-fi or free starbucks wifi)  STYLE - WINDOW 8  ..... is terrible ... BUT IT LOOKS REALLY SNAZZY TO PEOPLE WITH iPHONE OR ANDROID.  VOICE/SOUND QUALITY ....  EXCELLENT COMPARED TO MY OLD MOTOROLA FLIP PHONE.ALL IN ALL - THE BELOW 'CONS' ARE REALLY JUST ANNOYANCES/PREFERENCES/INHERENT WINDOWS ATTEMPT TO TAKE OVER YOUR ENTIRE INTERNET ACCESS ... IN EVERY WAY POSSIBLE.CONS:1,  BIG CON - SUDDENLY THE EASE OF PLAYING AND TRANSFERRING REGULAR MP3 MUSIC HAS BEEN ALMOST BLOCKED BY MICROSOFT AND WINDOWS 8.  THERE ARE TONS OF APPS TO "STREAM" AND "DOWNLOAD" MUSIC, BUT THERE IS NO EASY WAY TO GET, FIND, ORGANIZE AND PLAY MUSIC.>>>>  WE HAVE HAD WINDOWS FRAMEWORK FORCED UPON US (THE WORLD) ... AND SUDDENLY THERE IS NO BASIC WINDOWS FOLDER SYSTEM/MANAGEMENT/ACCESS.2. CRAZY - when you play music, and want to stop, there is no way to close the top drop down quick access to play/pause/volume.  You need to find an app or restart the phone.  I've never seen anything so crazy.3. I expected to be able to have massive storage on my micro-sd card, but the phone doesn't let you easily move/transfer/find/play music etc ... from the micro sd card.  It seems to want everything stored on internal storage (apps especially) which takes up most of the internal memory.4. CUSTOM LOOK.  It seems like it would be cool, but you have VERY, VERY LITTLE CUSTOMIZATION OF COLOR.  AS THE PICTURE SHOWS, YOU CAN CHOOSE (LIGHT OR DARK) AND THEN ONE COLOR FOR ALL TILES (PINK IN THE PICTURE).  Some apps (like the headphones icon in green) have a built in color, but I would like to make the colors look the way I want.5. I have had problems with G-Mail and full/proper access/sending basic g-mail.  The alternative google apps use the  m.google stripped down horrible mobile internet (no graphics and few functions).  Come on ... It is a modern system with a browser that is pretty full of features, but you end up often only having the minimal m.google access.  What year is this ???Not a 'con' .... The touch is very good.  I got a screen protector since everyone mentioned how easily scratches.  Even with a thick clear plastic cover, it does not affect touch sensitivity and use.6. BIGGEST 'CON' - VERY VERY BAD BATTERY LIFE.  TRIED BUYING A BACKUP UP SEPARATE BATTERY WHICH RESET THE WHOLE PHONE (AND I LOST EVERYTHING).  I SUGGEST A SMALL POCKET BATTERY RECHARGER.7.  NO FRONT FACING CAMERA ...  NO SELFIES FROM THIS PHONE (I don't do selfies, but if you are normal and like everyone else in the world, the lack of a front camera for Selfies you will HATE THIS PHONE.also (surprisingly light, light weight).  I don't know if that's good or bad, but it's lighter in weight than any phone I've every tried.finally T-Mobile "NO CONTRACT" price per minute IS MUCH HIGHER THAN SOME OF THE OTHER CARRIERS (like low end Boost, metro et al).

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Vinny
Reviews.Content: Great call quality on 4G.Good data speed on 4G ONLY.Great phone design: add memory, replace battery, etc.Terrible reception outside my local area. Virtually unusable in the car travelling the states, due to NO Service or lame 2G.Roughly 40% cheaper than AT&T; and Verizon.Basically, you pay less, get unlimited connections but slower connection (if any outside your local area).The Lumia 521 is a nice, attractive design.Windows 8 OS is fast, but has a few bugs like no Cut or Undo.The status bar is always hidden, which is very annoying.You have to be tied to a Microsoft account and email address.Apps often require you send your location info to Microsoft. I hate this about Microsoft.Be aware that this phone will store your data like OneNote notes somewhere in the M$ Cloud whether you like it or not.OK display: not retina, but still nice for a cheap phone.Camera is OK. No big deal. No flash.Overall it's OK. It's a sub-par phone for budget-minded people and teens. I much prefer my contract iPhone and AT&T; service over this for it's connection coverage, reliability and data speed. The T-Mobile Lumia 521 is useful as a secondary phone to throw around the family. For the $100 I'll keep it. I'll probably let the service expire, and then just reactivate it whenever I need to.

Reviews.Title: DENTS!
Reviews.Author: kady chu
Reviews.Content: it came with 2 dents and couple scratches and I bought it brand new but overall i like it alot

Reviews.Title: Buy it for the case of emergency
Reviews.Author: Gautam
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because my note wasn't working , it does works fine, but sometimes it hangs up, sometimes it goes out of network, sometimes the wifi goes crazy, well i do not expect much out of this tiny phone, it does works fine as far as its battery is concerned because its NOKIA.well buy it, if you really need a phone(to call or text someone), not recommended for DATA users.

Reviews.Title: Windows Phone! Ok for the price
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: While the phone is OK but the Windows operating system is not praise worthy. I used Android before buying the phone and to be honest the windows operating system is lacking many basic feature that comes with Android. I am not going to buy another windows based phone, it is simply not intuitive and just not smart. For example, windows phone does not have any world time zone, or even a stop watch built in. So one would have install separate software for each functions.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Waffleiron "WaffleIron"
Reviews.Content: Good phone overall, great price, if Winphone is your thing. I tried for six months.  Not for me. Ended up buying a Motorola Moto G. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: yea
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: The phone is pretty nice. Still figuring it out but i will get it. thank you very much for the phone.

Reviews.Title: Okay for the price
Reviews.Author: John E.
Reviews.Content: Because of the Windows operating system this phone has a pretty limited app selection. The camera doesn't have flash, so no flashlight and you can't make playlists on the phone or directly access files on the micro SD (at least I haven't been able to, not for lack of trying). Honestly, I infinitely preferred the 2-year-old Samsung Gravity I upgraded from to this thing. It's just not user-friendly, and the touchscreen cracks if you drop it on one of its corners.

Reviews.Title: Poor face detection
Reviews.Author: Stanley T
Reviews.Content: I gave this phone to my mom and she had lots of problems with her cheek pushing the hold/mute buttons during a call. Made for a very annoying user experience. Ended up returning the phone because of this.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing and not very user friendly.
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: The camera is not that good.  It doesn't have a front facing camera. It has a tendency to change settings inexplicably. My wife can't seem to enter people in her contacts unless they are on her facebook list and has all the facebook people on her phone whether she wants that or not; I think this may be a lack of knowledge of how it works, but she has been frustrated with this and can't figure any way around it.  Phones should not be that hard to master the basics.

Reviews.Title: Microsoft = Behind
Reviews.Author: Myra H
Reviews.Content: The thing that is great about Androids and Apples are their compatibility to all the best apps, but Microsoft does not have this same capability. I think the new software on both Microsoft phones and computers tries too hard to be different and actually just complicates everything. I don't like it, none of my friends like it, and I am sticking to Apple.

Reviews.Title: I hate this phone.
Reviews.Author: Amy Alpin "A is for Amy"
Reviews.Content: I got it for free with a service renewal, and I desperately miss my Droid. There are almost NO apps that match the ones I used regularly with my old phone, and the microphone is so sensitive that while I am trying to voice text, it picks up other people's conversations or radio in the background that is not even very loud. I use Square for my business (the little white cube that plugs in so you can accept credit cards from customers) and can not use it on this phone. I also can't get apps to most the places I shop, so no coupons with just a couple of swips of a finger. WiFi is iffy, and often fails to find information because "Data could not be reached at this time" in places I never had problems accessing wifi in the past. It's a pain to use, and didn't transfer the info from my old phone into this one as it said it would, so I ended up losing a LOT of info in the process. If you are looking for a phone for actual phone calls, texting and checking Facebook (if it will connect), you should be okay with this phone, but if you actually want good apps, stick with a droid or iPhone...it's worth the extra money. I can't wait for this year to be over so I can get rid of this thing.

Reviews.Title: nokia lumia 521 review
Reviews.Author: reyes e. garcia
Reviews.Content: this smartphone doesn't work great has many glitches like freezes keyboards starts typing randomly letters have  to constantly reset the phone wouldn't recommend this phone to my family i really disappointed with this phone but okay for making  calls

Reviews.Title: Basic smartphone
Reviews.Author: mikemo
Reviews.Content: Well worth the price of $25.  Switched from Blackberry to WP8, this phone has all the basic functions I need. Certainly not the same build quality or advanced functionality of a Blackberry, but it does the job.  I knew that it was not going to be as advanced as my BB, but I wanted a phone that would link and sync seamlessly with my W8 laptop and tablet.

Reviews.Title: It'll Do In a Pinch
Reviews.Author: P.M. "ProudMama"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nokia Lumia 521 due to the fact that I "misplaced" my previous T-mobile phone and finally decided to stop dragging my tail and just purchase a replacement phone. Due to my lucky stars I happened to capture the phone on its brief stint as Amazon's  "Deal of the Day" and got it for only $71.95.Now, I'm normally used to Samsung Androids (or anything that comes with a playstore or google play) so this phone was breath of fresh air. I'm still getting used to functions but I can say this phone is a fraction of a step up from my previous phone. I'm still with the T-mobile carrier, same number and everything, but service in my countryside home seems light years better more accommodating than my previous phone, and I think the layout is pretty nifty (this terminology coming from a 20-year-old).However, there are negatives which mainly steam from the way apps run on this system. The app store is a FAR cry from the playstore, let me tell you. The same apps I had on my own phone, run COMPLETELY different on this system, so much so that even the ones I used daily on my own phone I wont even bother with on this one. And some apps don't exist in the app store at all!Overall, the phone is great, I feel like what I received excels what I paid for and if I had to make the purchase again I would in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for a used item
Reviews.Author: Misheck Pencilo Mabimba
Reviews.Content: Pretty cool item but it has issues with power system and the battery was dead and had to buy a separate battery. Normally, it would start and powerout itself in the middle of text or phone call. Maybe a new item would make a perfect phone.

Reviews.Title: I Want to Like It
Reviews.Author: Dennis N. Akers
Reviews.Content: I bought this about two weeks ago and want to like it...but it is fighting me and I just can't.  I am comfortable with Windows and like that aspect of the phone..I am happy with the TMobile reception I receive, but almost from the start I began having problems sending text and making use of the "People" function.  When I touch the People app, it goes there but when I attempt to send text to anyone on that list, it reverts back to the tile.  When I got to text and type in the name of anyone, it refuses to pull down the info from the People app.  I have been on both Nokia and TMobile forums trying to find an answer.  None so far that work....the one I don't want to do is reset the entire phone..when I do that I lose everything I have done with it and I don't want to go there.  This is not an isolated problem...It almost certainly is a problem with the phone...and the operating system..In all honesty I cannot recommend this phone and soon will just pull the sim out and go with a Moto G which I just bought for two sons as a gift.  No more Windows phones...Android hopefully will be better.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 good but not up to android or iphone standards yet
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: Basically I do like the phone, but windows 8 is not up to android or iphone standards yet.  There are certain features not on this phone but nothing I can't like without.  I'm going to stick with it for awhile to see how I like it in the long term

Reviews.Title: Good value for your money
Reviews.Author: Andrea V.
Reviews.Content: The price-quality of the phone is great. However, you cannot open 2 apps at the same time, so every time you change to another application you have to start all over.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Perro
Reviews.Content: It's a good deal for the asking price of $120. I still prefer the Iphone but am not willing to pay that much for a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 521
Reviews.Author: Hart
Reviews.Content: I am used to android phones, this one is a windows phone,  I am trying to get used to the layout of the tiles. The battery life is somewhat disappointing, it drains even when not in use.

Reviews.Title: Nokia lumia
Reviews.Author: Elana Tsingos
Reviews.Content: This is a phone for my son. He loves it, so I guess it's good. Battery life is terrible unless you have the battery saver on.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Rose Dorilus
Reviews.Content: I really love my new phone but it was locked so it was the only disappointment but love it!!!!!!!! Thanks

Reviews.Title: good product but problems at the begining and big minus win8 :(
Reviews.Author: Wojciech Kudyba
Reviews.Content: all good, but when tried to copy numbers from Nokia with big sim card it was not possible. Consider typing all numbers to this new phone. good luck

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: avphoneuser
Reviews.Content: This is a solid phone, but I would not recommend it to someone who is constantly on their phone because it can die in a matter of hours. I liked that it appeared to be heavy but it turns out it is a light phone. The touch screen is pretty sensitive. I believe it needs to be unlocked for use overseas.

Reviews.Title: Huge issue for many music lovers who wish to, or have already bought this phone!!
Reviews.Author: Ernest Cedric Alexander
Reviews.Content: If your buying this phone not just for the price or it's communication capabilities but also the included music apps and their supposed high quality functionality then buyer beware!!! I won't do a bash fest but I'll just say do your research on the incompatibility issues that are going on with Xbox music, Nokia music, windows media player, and the windows 8 phone  apps. Short examples = track duplication, disappearing tracks, photo duplication, disappearing album art, disappearing playlist, etc.. I'm not a tech newbie and have many friends who are tech savvy  who also cannot figure out whats going on. Our (very cynical) conclusion is Microsoft is doing their Microsoft thing... hoping that their customers will figure out what the problem is. This is not just specific to this particular phone but across the windows 8 platform.This is coming from a windows man who thinks that other than the music issue this is a great little phone that is just right for that person who wants to try out the Wp8 platform against the i OS and Android.Not a terribly big issue, but one just the same, that is not being pointed out enough in reviews. Like I said just do the research before you make the purchase if music functionality on your phone is important to you. It's my understanding that Microsoft has known about this for sometime now and still has not addressed it properly as of yet.

Reviews.Title: Its an okay phone.
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this phone isn't THAT great after almost a year experience. Compared to what you can get out of other phones of the same price, don't get this one.Cons -- Sometimes the camera app won't even open, just black screen that it sends you back to the home screen.- App store has a bunch of rip-offs and the good apps arent even well made.- "Nokia Mix Radio" is terrible- Battery doesn't last more than 6 hours when power saver is off and brightness is on low.- Isnt much you can do with the phone, no really good games, or utility apps you may get out of iOS or Android. Mainly text and calling.Pros -- 8MP camera is okay.- Texting is pretty smooth.- Talk is pretty smooth.- Home screen is very customizable.- Not a slow phone, and even after a year of use it hasnt gotten any slower- Durable, I never got a case for it and only one time did it get bad cracks, were I replaced the phone entirely.Overall, get an android or iphone. The phone itself is okay, if it ran android, then it'd be a good phone. But since its a windows phone, its pretty bad. If only there was a way you could put android on it yourself...wink wink..

Reviews.Title: Phone speaker defect
Reviews.Author: Sivakumar
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone couple of days back, Now the phone speaker not working properly and getting "kirch kreech" sound  while playing any audio/video.I would like to return this product now :(.

Reviews.Title: You'll like it if you like WIN 8.
Reviews.Author: Ryan DeMat
Reviews.Content: it works smoothly and its fast. excellent for a cheap phone. just like the windows 8 OS, there is VERY limited customization compared to other phone OS's such as Android or Apple. I gave it to my older brother as a gift and he loves it.

Reviews.Title: bad experiance
Reviews.Author: Nasir hassen
Reviews.Content: the phone i bought was not like it is advertised. they say its in a good condition but i found a lot of scratches. they say the phone is unlocked but it was not. i dont recommend to anyone to buy stuf from them

Reviews.Title: Worse phone ever does not work
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Worse phone ever does not work. Ends calls with notice, phone freezes up. requested a refund was denied had use phone for 1 month and its defective...DO NOT BUY!!!

Reviews.Title: Windows
Reviews.Author: jackie jones
Reviews.Content: This product isn't what I thought it would be. It shuts off right in the middle of something. It did come in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing, good price, but that's all
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: Unit failed to activate the first day. Returned to T-Mobile store and had to be issued a new phone number, which did activate.When it was working, it was great, but that only lasted about three weeks. The phone would not wake up from sleep mode unlessthe battery was removed and re-installed. What a pain! Returned to store again, and was told to mail the dead rock back to the repair center. About ten days later, got a replacement with no back cover! Back to the T-Mobile store again, and was informed there was nothing they could do (two week return period had passed)! I would have to wait to hear from one of their stores when, and if, any back-covers became available! (I did find a cover on the internet, however.)The phone is now  working, but trying to push those tiny momentary contact switches that are about the size of the proverbial gnat"s you-know-what is close to impossible! Still waiting for the replacement back cover to arrive.It may have been a lemon, but I hope that 521 will finally work properly. Think I'll use up my minutes and dump the thing.Just glad I did not drop my previous provider!

Reviews.Title: Died after 1 month use.
Reviews.Author: Kha Vue
Reviews.Content: Phone would not charge after 1 month use; only after waiting 3 weeks to receive it. Horrible phone and service. I would not recommend this phone. Save yourself the headache.

Reviews.Title: you get what you paid for
Reviews.Author: amna
Reviews.Content: its a good phone when it comes to being a phone. its surprising how difficult it is for most smartphones to make and receive calls. this phone executes that really well. it doesn't have a front camera. it only connects to my wifi when it wants to even when all of my other devices are connected to it and working perfectly well. it only sends and receives pictures when it wants to even if my 4g is on and working with my other apps. picture quality is okay. and sometimes it freezes on me. but ay it was so cheap what did i expect.

Reviews.Title: unreliable
Reviews.Author: hamid madani
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for 4 months ,then it did not work anymore,constantly showing No Service. T-Mobil stores could not figure out the reason. T-Mobil sent me a refurbished one under warranty. then the exact same thing happend. I had to return it again. you may want to stay away from this Nokia.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift ... lasted until Jan 12th. :(
Reviews.Author: Wade Smart "Wade Smart"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a gift for Christmas. My wife has really enjoyed this phone until the last week when its just gone crazy. Wont hold a charge. The slightest bump, even in your hand, and it turns off. Charges for 48 hours and the charge lasts 4 or 5 (not calls, no data on). Swapped the battery for another one.. same issue. If I can work out these issues, its really a great phone.

Reviews.Title: nice phone for the money
Reviews.Author: Szook
Reviews.Content: its really light my cus likes it.im a apple person but this phone is a good entry level smart phone.

Reviews.Title: nice entry smartphone for $150 or less
Reviews.Author: John N Denver
Reviews.Content: I am upping my review to 4 stars because of the Wi-Fi calling app.  If you get this phone the first thing you should do is update the software and do a hard reset - this will wipe out everything which is why you want to do it when you first get the phone.  This will install the Wi-Fi calling app.  It will use Wi-Fi seamlessly to make phone calls - when my gf calls me over the Wi-Fi it still shows as her phone number calling.  This is a great feature for her because her workplace is in a near dead zone.I bought this from Walmart for my girlfriend and she has had it for a week.  The first day after about 3-4 hours the screen wouldn't respond to touches.  Had to take the battery out and reset the phone.  Haven't had that issue again.  After updating it a couple of days ago (20+ minute process in itself) it now send texts to my phone l i k e  t h i s and only about 30 characters per message even if the message is longer.  She still has a week to decide to keep it or not.Pros: cheap ($130 @ largest discount store, $150 @ T-Mobile store - don't know why it is $100 more here)  Wi-Fi calling feature  voice quality is good  win phone 8 looks pretty nice  SD slot  removable batteryCons: locked up on first day  no led charge indicator so you really have know idea when it is completely charged (this part is absurd)  no camera flash - would have paid another $10-20 for this  only 512M memory  can't set different alarm volumes (as far as we could tell)If you are looking for a cheap phone with a sim card this might be it.  We are hoping to get it unlocked by T-Mobile for our trip to Europe this summer but this is a big unknown right now - another absurd thing is that you buy a phone but you don't control the phone.(deleted part about alarm sounds previews - turns out I stupidly didn't notice the play button next to each alarm)Update: TMobile did unlock the phone so that we could use it in Europe.  Used with a Vodaphone SIM while there without issue.

Reviews.Title: headache is an understatement
Reviews.Author: jonathan
Reviews.Content: I got this as a replacement phone. Bought two different sim cards through t mobile still didn't work. T mobile tech support is a joke. The level of costumer care is about on par as going to a witch Dr to fix a broken toe. If you do decide to go with those you will end up paying more just to get it turned on assuming you have the few weeks needed for t mobile to not only help you but for all the times you end up spending it back and forth a few dozen times.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Debbie "Debbie"
Reviews.Content: Going from an android to a windows phone is like going from today back into caveman times. Literally returned it the same day I got it.

Reviews.Title: Not All that Great
Reviews.Author: KHRYSTAL
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I love Nokia and the price was unbeatable.  However, I was greatly disappointed.  My calls drop and my bluetooth keeps getting disconnected. Also, the screen keeps getting stuck.  I like to multi-task and I am unable to do that with this phone. There is no way to talk on the phone and check my email at the same time.  There is also no flash on the camera.  The pros are that it has a sleek design and it's a Windows phone.  Just not enough for me to keep the phone.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: husani
Reviews.Content: It is a really nice phone. I did not get the chance to use it because I have a standard sim card and this one uses a mini sim. I went with the reviews and bought it. I hate I had to return it as it is almost what I wanted (I am not so sure about phones with touch screen function buttons as that is why I needed a new phone.)Overall, i would have kept it if my sim card was compatible...

Reviews.Title: Not a new phone as described & It's Defected.
Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: First, there're bubbles and lines under the screen film. Obviously, it's not a new phone, it's been used and returned.Second, it can not turn off. After i press the power button, it shows "goodbye", then screen turn black. But after 1 second, it automaticallyturn back on. I've tried couple times. There's no chance to turn it off. Have to take out the battery to shut it down.Request a replacement within the first half hour after i receive the package.Hope the seller would send me a real BRAND NEW phone.

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: opirty "opirty"
Reviews.Content: Bought for a Lumia phone which was returned as it did not meet my expectations It would probably be OK.

Reviews.Title: Unable to unlock this phone
Reviews.Author: simsim
Reviews.Content: The phone is great, no doubt.The problem is that the phone  is locked to T-mobile.I bought it to use it in canada and for my vacations in the US. T-mobile refused to unlock it: you must activate the phone and be  one of their clients for several months (more than I can wait...). The Nokia Company refused to unlock it too....Expect to pay between 40 to 75 canadian dollars in Canada to get it unlocked. You may find websites that propose to unlock it for less, but no warranty on that. Finally, it took me more than 15 days to get it unlocked and the final cost was near the one I could have paid if I have bought it in canada. I should 've bought it there: less stress and efforts...

Reviews.Title: Window Phone has some annoying issues which Adroid phone does not experience
Reviews.Author: Objective
Reviews.Content: This Window phone has some very annoying issues:  1) Often, restarting itself  in the middle of use or upon connecting to a link2) Bunch of non-functional icons with alphabet name appeared from no where and keep replicating.  The only way I'd get rid of these ghost icons is to reset to factory, that would ensue a repeating down loading of updates.  I've been wondering if there are any impending updates to fix these annoying issues.  I still own the original Samsung Galaxy S. It has never given me any upsetting issues comparing with the new Window Nokia Lumia.

Reviews.Title: i guess it was great for a little while
Reviews.Author: jackie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone in march and now it is may and my phone shuts off and on by itself and the battery is defective now. I have now dropped it on the floor or water. but I love the windows features.

Reviews.Title: dont be fooled, stick to an iphone
Reviews.Author: clownxsf
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I'm a windows fan.  Xbox, PC, but this phone has to be the most piece of garbage I've ever had.Phone is just a piece of junk, internet explorer turns black sometimes so u have to constantly re load the page to see it.  Your music is replicated over 6 times on your memory card for no stupid reason, and there is no fix for it. Microsoft acts is they never heard of the problem  before even though its wide spread.  Your Mobile account app to look at your account does not want to let u log in, so u have to call in customer support every time to change your pass word.  What a nightmare  of a phone.  Don't waste your time, total garbage, wish I stayed with iPhone, way too many issues with windows system.

Reviews.Title: dont buy
Reviews.Author: angela fisher
Reviews.Content: took long time to get it to work had to call several people to figure out what was wrong finally called people made the phone and they fixed it

Reviews.Title: Arrived on time
Reviews.Author: Coleen
Reviews.Content: Had problems straight out of box....had to end up paying $20 tot mobile to replace the phone. Not sure if i was mailed a bad phone or if it's the phone...but the one new one front tmobile works fab...thank god for my insurance plan.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: carl barta
Reviews.Content: It is supposed to be an " entry level smart phone". That's the problem. Unfortunately, Nokia/Microsoft like other manufacturers abandoned quality non smart or half smart phones.I quickly found out that the phone does not, to my big surprise, have a flash and that i can make better pictures with my old Nokia C3-01. Off course, it did not have the handy flash light either. Since my C3-01's screen problems went away, at least temporarily, I decided not to explore where else this entry level smart thing cut the corners and for the first time in my life decided to return a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: It ok if you don't like picture messages
Reviews.Author: Trueamber1
Reviews.Content: It was a gift to a friend and they liked it but after two days they could not receive picture messages and still can't. It was well packaged and everything. But was defected . I email the man and respond fast but it was like he didn't believe me so I didn't even message back and my friend just took it up to the tmobile store.  No charger Is included r headphones just the phone no warranty.

Reviews.Title: it's OK
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: everything is OK, but sometime the screen turn off automatically. i couldn't use my headphone to listen to music because the sound was really bad, so that I had to buy a new headphone.

Reviews.Title: required phone services to work
Reviews.Author: James "James"
Reviews.Content: I gave this a 2 stars because it is useless without the phone services. The phone services or card is still expensive. The features look good. I bought this because I thought I could only use Wifi network only temp. but it's useless without services. I don't recommend to anyone unless you are willing to pay a higher rate monthly services.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: pen name
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the phone itself.-Impossible to sync music to your phone. I have been trying for 2 hours and it simply won't work. I've tried different ways of syncing, they all freeze and I have to end the program from cmd prompt.-Horrible battery life, hope you're the type to bring your charger with you for a night out-Impossible to update. Have fun looking at a "restarting" screen for hours on end and getting nowhereNow for t-mobile-I have 2 bars in the heart of Dallas-Dropped calls on the rare occasion that I have full reception-Don't try streaming anything. I like to listen to baseball podcasts in the morning. They will work for about 5-10 minutes and then stop, no matter what I do I can't get them to start again without playing them from the beginningThe camera is nice, sound quality is good, but that is to be expected in this day in age. Once again microsoft has ruined another operating system by trying to be tech savvy and straying from their roots of making a simple, easy to use OS.If you've got a phone that works and you like, stick with it. I'm 23 and this crap is too complex for me.

Reviews.Title: Some sellers like Best Laptops And More
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: The phone is locked. Some sellers like Best Laptops And More, fools customers that it is unlocked phone.I bought this phone to use it out of United States but I couldn't use it because nobody was able to unlocked it.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: When I started the phone up, it froze on me within 5 minutes. I had to take the battery out to restart it. The power button does not respond when it freezes. Going from Google to Microsoft was not my first choice, but i liked the price!! I liked the Lumia a little better after I personalized the menu. Good battery life. I'm still not a fan. I dearly miss my Galaxy S2. Microsoft lacks a lot of little things like swype, front facing camera, & easy access to memory & SIM card. I never had these problems but it cost 5x as much as this little Nokia.

Reviews.Title: Not Unlocked
Reviews.Author: Louis Valadez-Ramos
Reviews.Content: I don't know why i expected it to be, but i did. I returned the phone, good phone, just not for me.

Reviews.Title: Grow tiny bit more frustrated each month.
Reviews.Author: CASTRO
Reviews.Content: Purchased Aug 2013.  Seemed to be pretty good deal for $120.  At the time, the apps I needed were not available (specific to my banking and notetaking), but the store continues to grow.  A few have since appeared, so that is a plus.  The battery continues to only last two days on standby with every possible function turned off, battery-saver on, no calls made, or Internet searches done.  That sucks pretty good particularly when travelling.  The latest coup has been the Bluetooth not functioning.  Bought a car that has a Windows-based voice rec/Bluetooth interface and ithe phone just drops the connection each time.  Even went to the dealership to be sure I wasn't just doing the steps incorrectly (or the other three people who tried it for me), and guess what? The salesman's phone connected perfectly Btw - '12 FIAT 500 Blue & Me system.  So those are my main issues.  May just be I received a crappy device.  It's actually not bad for anyone who does not want to spend a small fortune over the course of a couple years just to be able to make a few calls each week, and maybe take a picture or two.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 521
Reviews.Author: chiessa
Reviews.Content: I got in the mail what I ordered but the phone was not what I expected it to be so I am a little disappointed about my choice. other than that I am very well satisfied with  Amazon.com and everyone that is affiliated with them.

Reviews.Title: stop working within a month.
Reviews.Author: sadaf ghumman
Reviews.Content: The product came with a week with everything included. But it would not turn on the second time I try to turn it on. The charging ion would come up when I would charge but it just wouldn't power up. Then suddenly after a few days it powered up again. Again next week it happened again, but powered up after a few days. Then the next week it completely stop working. So I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Nokia
Reviews.Author: Jernul Sampson
Reviews.Content: Great work an on time if I need something else I would be happy to deal with this customer again

Reviews.Title: Bad ergonomic design
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Gerulat
Reviews.Content: Bad ergonomic design, very slippery back plate, constantly losing the grip on it when trying to hold it. Easy to drop. Power button worked intermittantly, not as easy to use as an android phone, extra steps to perform the same functions. Call quality was ok but not great, there are much better phones out there.

Reviews.Title: I bought one for $69 but now I want another one
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for only $69 but now I need to buy another one for someone and the price keeps jumping from $60 up to 80 and 90 ahhhhh

Reviews.Title: Parental control is terrible
Reviews.Author: Tracy Auen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my 12 year daughter.  As far as the phone  working and doing what smart phones do, it's great.  But I am very dissapointed with the parental functions and options that are available.  Apple has there's set up were u can turn off pretty much any function or app on the phone and if your child wants to download something,  ect.  they have you the adult approve of whatever it is and enter your password .  This accurs everytime and is very convenient for keeping up with content.  This Nokia requires you pay an additional 5 dollars a month for parental locks and it's really not that good.  Everything is either on or off and if you kid wants a game or an app you have to sign on tho the windows page and disable  the locks.  Everything about that aspect if very inconvenient and not user friendly.  If you put internet limitations on your child's phone(ratings). If he or she signs on with wifi those limitations are gone and he not she can view anything they want too!

Reviews.Title: Completely different phone from my prior phones
Reviews.Author: potential customer
Reviews.Content: Being different is neither good nor bad, just different.  I haven't figured out most of the features yet, and probably never will.  I wanted a phone, which I got.  Setting options are ring + vibrate, vibrate, or off.  Hmmmm . . . am I the only one missing the "meeting" feature on my original cell phone 14 years ago?  (I could tell it to vibrate or to make no noise as of, say noon, for x number of hours.)  Meeting was a great feature because my phone remained on and I didn't forget to turn it back on later.T-Mobile transferred my stored data.  Sort of.  Their first attempt only copied a fraction of my data.  The 2nd attempt seems to have moved all data, but it isn't exactly correct. Not all phone numbers stuck to the correct name and some mobile numbers are now landlines, etc.  Kinda weird.  I bought this 2 months ago and am still double checking who I'm calling and which phone number it really is.I have taken some pics & videos.  They look fine, but please note that I am neither a photographer nor an artist!  I haven't figured out how to get them off my phone yet.One weird "feature" is that the speaker is on the back of the phone.  Huh?  What purpose does that serve?  My mouth doesn't wrap around to the back of the phone!  This makes my public conversations even more public.  When I set my phone down, then I have to put it face down for the speaker to work best, but when my phone is face down in my lap (i.e.: on speaker while driving), the touch screen phone has a tendency to dial other numbers, put me on mute, turn off the speaker, etc.  So, I'm neither a huge fan of the touch screen nor of the speaker on the back.The phone takes too long to turn back on after it was turned off.I haven't figured out any way to customize various volumes, such as ring tone, reminder (calendar alerts), key stroke volume, earpiece volume, and speaker volume.  I'd prefer that the alarm set to wake me up be really loud, but I don't need the keystroke volume to be equally loud, for example.  (This could be operator error, but teenage helpers haven't resolved this issue for me, either.)One irritating thing about the call history is that it omits information.  It does not include ahistory of all incoming calls.  It omits some, but not all "unknown" phone numbers as well as numbers of people who leave voicemail, and it omits some phone numbers of people who not already in my contacts.  That's just weird . . . and sometimes irritating.I sent a copious quantity of texts.  I like that this phone learns my typical vocabulary, jargon, & writing style quickly.  Based on what I write, it anticipates the subsequent words well.  For example, I text the phrase "scrip envelopes" and my address frequently.  When I type "scrip" it anticipates that "envelopes" will follow.  It does the same thing with my address and names that I frequently text.  Kinda creepy, but mighty handy feature.  I like this one.  Also, it does not spell correct with the horrendous, vulgar, and embarrassing corrections that I've seen come from IPhone users.  (This I count as a *huge* plus!)A teenager found the settings to make my phone use wi-fi, so I should now be able to get pics off.  She plans to teach me how to do that as a Christmas gift, which I consider a good gift!I still haven't figured out how to sync my phone with my computer, but anticipate doing so in the future.I do want to use office software -- mainly excel -- but haven't figured out how to use it.  Also, unless I can figure out how to sync my phone so spreadsheets can be printed, I'm not interested in this feature.FYI: I haven't used the following features:haven't been online. period.creative studiodata sensegameshere drive betainternet explorervideosnokia musicoffice (I'd like to use this, but haven't figured out how!)one notepanorama picphototbeamerstoret-mobile tvwalletweatherwi-fi callingWell, this has been long, but will hopefully help someone else with their agonizing phone purchasing concerns.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Almost there, Could be alot better

Reviews.Content: Well after almost a week here is my break down of nokia lumia 521.Pros:1. Size is nice and the screen is nice and bright.2. Easy to use the interface for those new to windows like myself3. Very little to no lag at all given that it only has 512 mb of ram4. Decent battery life on medium settings5. Only Paid $80 plus taxes for it at hsn fire saleand now the cons...Cons:1. Lack of apps, doesn't have my bank app yet, I use this app all the time2. No track scrubbing...have to old fashion hold the button to rewind3. Only internet explorer and that is lacking alot of features that is found in other internet apps4.No backlit touch buttons! Reviews.Title: Fools gold
Reviews.Author: credit risk
Reviews.Content: This phone is a good value on the surface.  A great value.  A 5 star value.  I got it for $60 and it is very responsive for email and surfing and texting.  The camera is really solid, seems to let in a lot of light although it has no flash.  This phone does the basics really well and is pretty easy/intuitive to use.IT's no Taj Mahal of phones like an iPHone but for the money is works surprisingly well.But that's before the random reboots creep in.  I've had 2 of these and they reboot like rabbits multiply.  I read it is a loose battery problem but I haven't been able to correct it with shims in the battery compartment so far.I'm starting to think it is a software problem and related to my setup. Or ....I just don't know.  I may have to return my second phone as well. The " get what you pay for" clouds have now moved in over this phone and have obscured the earlier sunlight.

Reviews.Title: good but not really!
Reviews.Author: shweta singh
Reviews.Content: for 80 bucks its a good deal. But i was using android before this. And whatsapp and Viber are too slow. So if u r a chatting person...i would recommend not to buy this.

Reviews.Title: nice but has major flaws
Reviews.Author: Mc Call
Reviews.Content: This phone whold be perfect if the keyboard letters was a bit wider when the phone is in portraits mode. Almost every word I type. Is incorrect. Forget about getting a email or a text written quick because your gonna need to go back and correct the spelling of every other  word. And my fingers are. Skinny.i hate to imaging a fat fingered person typing on this thing. Also when browsing internet you can back up a page but after you back up you can't go forward. How dumb.and forget about laying down on the bed and type. The screen will constantly be rotating with every move you make. Rotation. Can't even lock on this phone. The still didn't release a update. Its no camera flash either. I guess that's it. If these few but major things could be improved this phone would be a winner. big improvements needed. Look up at the top where I spelled "would " wrong. I actually had to go through this whole paragraph correcting mid spelled words because the keyboard sucks. The phone won't even allow me to select it and fix it. I fixed all the other errors. Who it act like it can select that word.and the last sentence "who" should be "why" but its not legging me correct it. Oh well. I'm done in not gonna spend another minute correcting errors. If I was typing from mh iPhone 4s I would have been finished writing this review with no errors. A half hour passed already.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: Joy Eve
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I was in need of a major upgrade from a non smart phone. The price is amazing considering there's no contract that comes along with it... However, I've realized that you get what you pay for. The first 2 weeks with this phone were fine, however, soon it started turning off by itself (meaning the power button doesn't do anything.) The screen just goes black and I have to wait for some time for it to react. Very inconvenient during emergencies and just in general. Another problem is that there are multiple thumbnails of picture and photo albums, but just one physical copy of the picture. So when I try to delete the picture, the whole file disappears. Another downside is that the Windows Store for app, games, etc. is SO very limited. That means no Instagram, Vine, Snapchat, etc. (Yes, there are copy cat apps for it, but it just isn't the same.)I will be keeping this phone for some time, at least until I can afford a more high end smartphone. Overall, the phone is easy to maneuver.I would give this phone 2 stars, but the good pricing forces me to give 3.I will update on positive and negative points of this phone after further use. Please feel free to ask any questions!

Reviews.Title: gokia lumnIA 521
Reviews.Author: Jane Brown
Reviews.Content: it took me three weeks to figure out how to use this telephone I had to contact three individuals and the T-Mobile store. There are no icons that are similar to the ones on and on the my old phone and no instructions. I even went to the Internet for instructions, but that they were too confusing. It works almost fine now I still have a few more things left to figure out. I don't like the way the tiles are laid out for apps. Jane Brown

Reviews.Title: OK, not great.
Reviews.Author: J. Hastings "DryHeat"
Reviews.Content: I have used Nokia and T-Mobile for some time and have always used relatively cheap phones. I break them and don't need a game phone. My last phone was a Nokia X2 with a standard buttons and a real QWERTY keyboard. The Lumia is the first touch screen phone I have used. I used both phones with the same T-Mobile 1500 min of voice and text plus 30 megs of data. Yes that is megs and not gigs. I don't need a lot of data. I have had the phone for over a month now. That is the context for this review.You can go from the X2 to the Lumia easily for very basic use. Beyond that it takes some time to learn. Finding how to do things often takes searching the internet for them. This is a Windows 8 phone but it is not like your win 7 desktop. On the X2 you could select an item and then you would have a key for options. In win 7 you would have drop down menus of options. You have neither on the Lumia. Some options are hidden. Some options are little icons, very little. There are a lot of them but usually only a few on a screen at a time. If you need reading glasses you will want to have them ready until you know the icons by placement. There is also on some screens a "..." which indicate there is more information below the bottom of the screen, that can be accessed by sliding the image up. In some other cases there are option that have to be taken while selecting an item, not after it is selected. To select an item you just tap it, but to bring up options touch and hold the item.On the main (home) screen there is a phone icon. If you tap it a list of calls, incoming, outgoing, and missed, comes up. At the bottom are four icons, voicemail, keypad, people, search, and "...". If you slide the image up you will see the names of the icons and two more options, Delete All, and Settings. There are no other option to see. No option for sorting the calls by incoming, outgoing or missed, something I could do on the X2. I did find that if I touch and hold a number there is an option to delete that call. I like to keep missed calls and some special calls listed in the call history so "delete all" is not an option for me. The delete call option is actually easier and quicker to use than the options menu and buttons on the X2. You just have to know how to find it.Another option that took me some time to find was for forwarding text messages or resending them. From the Home screen there is a Messaging icon. Tapping it brings up a list of threads or conversations. If you tap on one a list of messages in that thread appear. Again, there are little icons at the bottom and the "...". You will want to check them out. If you want to forward a message or resend an old one you have to know there are options that come up by touching and holding an entry for a message, delete, forward and copy. However, if there is only one message in a thread then you only have that and when you tap on the thread you go right into the message and those three options are not offered. If you touch and hold the listing for the thread the only option you get is to delete the thread. If I am wrong about this someone let me know. This is more difficult than on the X2.I have large fingers and I need to hold the phone in landscape orientation and not portrait or I get to many errors where it thinks I want the next key over. In landscape orientation the keyboard is better than the X2. Otherwise the X2 is better.Sometime the Lumia does not respond to my touch. This mostly happen with incoming calls and I can't get it to answer. It does not happen often and it can be with other features too, not just calls.Once the Lumia froze and I had to take the battery out. To do it as the instructions say is almost impossible for me. I find it easiest to do by releasing the side opposite the power button first. Be careful, the halves can be hard to hang onto. There is suppose to be a way to reboot the Lumia holding the power button but it did not work for me.The camera can be better than the one in the X2, which was not much good, but not always. The problem with the camera is it needs good lighting or any movement of the subject or camera causes terrible blur. In the sunshine it does a good job.On the plus side. The Lumia has data use controls that limit the data use. If you make good use of them you can get by with the 30 meg limit on the prepay plans. On the home screen is a Data Sense icon. Using Data Sense you can let the Lumia know how many days you have until your megs expire, and how many megs you have. I add a few days and reduce the number megs to leave me some extra room but I don't seem to need to do that. The Data Sense icon will display the numbers of days and megs left. In the setting for the Lumia under Celluar is a setting for Data Connection. You can turn that off and stop data use on the cellular network. There is another for Limited Wi-Fi Connectivity and another for Data Roaming.WiFi works for me. The use of data over Wi-Fi does count against my data limit. I have not paid much attention to whether calls count. 1500 min has been more than enough for me anyway. I assume Wi-Fi calls do not. At the end of my plan's 30 days I download maps and apps with my remaining megs.If I use the Lumia much the battery runs out much faster than the X2. It also charges faster. Not a big deal for me.The voice quality of callers is probably the best of any phone I have had. The phone feels good and fits my media pocket on my pants.If you want a Windows phone it is good for the money, but it is not a great phone.

When on speaker it's not clear at all.  I had one week left before having to renew and it said I can only make emergency calls.  I wasted $50 for a month and hardly got to use it. Reviews.Author: Nigeria92692
Reviews.Content: There's a reason why this phone is so cheap. I guess it gets the job done but there are so many things that can be fixed.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Don't be suckered into buying Windows Phone, the cheap price and decent technical specs will fool you into thinking this phone offers the complete smartphone experience. My major deal-breaker with this phone is that each app has its own unchangeable settings for read/writing to the sd card, which means that 9 times out of 10 you will be FORCED to save to the 4gb phone memory. Not to mention the lack of apps in the first place, so even if you are displeased with the performance of one app you are S*** OUT OF LUCK to find a more comprehensive app.

Reviews.Title: Amazing phone and operating system, lousy customer service at TMobile
Reviews.Author: Bill B "mbb"
Reviews.Content: OK, so I know this is supposed to be a review of the phone; it's hardware and software. And after a month testing it out on a prepaid plan, I knew this would fit my family's needs and I was ready to go. However, for cellphones the full experience is directly linked to the wireless provider. So, despite  my admiration for this Nokia phone and Microsoft Windows, I am giving it one star. Yesterday I called TMobile to activate a family plan with four lines and port from ATT. This is where things turned sour. After two hours of frustrating customer service, 4 different phonecalls, 6-8 different representatives, one dropped call (they hung up on me after I requested to talk to a supervisor), and numerous annoying attempts to reassure me that everything would be fine, I gave up. This might be an isolated issue and my bad luck. It seems things went wrong when my address, in a new development, would not be recognized in their system. This technical issue made it impossible for them to complete the activation. So because of the poor customer service I am sticking with ATT. I simply do not trust tmobile to make this a smooth experience. And I advise you to reconsider switching to tmobile. It might not be worth the hassle.
